@Tay0

Mike Stone @mike 2023-10-09 06:43

@MobileOak There's no mechanism in Mastodon to communicate the results of reports since not all reports have the required information to do that. Speaking specifically of the reports you've made, it looks like there were two total and the account was suspended in both cases.

@kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-10-09 05:53

@Tay0 Canada last I checked. 😉

Mike Stone @mike 2023-10-09 05:51

@MobileOak at their discretion. Occasionally we'll see a report for an account that's already been blocked/kicked remotely, so we don't generally action those reports. There's not much to be gained in blocking an account that's already been blocked at the host. We don't always wait to see remote action before we take action ourselves though. Did that answer the question? 3/3

@kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-10-09 05:50

@MobileOak the remote account in any way, but it can either pop a warning up for people on Fosstodon if they access the remote account (Limit) or block that individual from appearing to people on Fosstodon (Block). It's pretty much the same for all instance moderators who aren't on the reported individual's home instance. The home instance moderator can take several different actions. Limiting their ability to post, freezing the account, or outright kicking them out. That's 2/

@kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-10-09 05:47

@MobileOak Sorry about that. I've been gone all weekend. Just getting back home.

What happens when you report a post on another server varies depending on you. When you're making the report, you have the option to send the report to remote the remote instance(s). If you do that, the moderators both here on Fosstodon and on the remote instance(s) get a copy of the report, and each of them has an opportunity to action it. If we action the report locally, it doesn't impact 1/

@kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-26 22:03

@adamsdesk Absolutely. My mother had Alzheimer's, and long after she lost the capability of using a computer she could still video call and send messages using a Google Assistant screen. She could even get slideshows of the the latest pictures of her grandkids. That kind of thing shouldn't be locked behind a paywall of used to advertise.

@PINE64

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-26 21:39

@adamsdesk I've been coughing at @PINE64 for years now, but so far they've successfully managed to ignore me. Now that Mycroft has dropped out of the market, it's virtually impossible to get a smart speaker that isn't spying on your every move. NeonAI still sells the #Mark2 from Mycroft, but they're super expensive with such low market penetration. Would be amazing to see someone really put some juice behind it.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-26 21:33

This is one of the reasons I've been a big supporter of #Mycroft in the past, and I'm still supporting #OVOS and #NeonAI. I think a voice driven UI (VUI) is important, but the biggest players in that market are Google and Amazon, and their motivation isn't improving the experience for the people using their devices, it's monetizing anything and everything they can. I'd love to see a new smart speaker (*cough* @PINE64 *cough*) that would support OVOS or NeonAI soon.

https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2023/09/amazon-wants-to-charge-a-subscription-fee-for-alexa-eventually/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-22 00:17

Hovering over the link displays the full source URL.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 23:14

@JustineSmithies I think that's intentional, though I don't off the top of my head know the reasoning. I'm not seeing counts other than replies either.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 22:20

@Fosstonaut I don't think so? Maybe? I'm not sure I see a whole lot of difference between having the link card and having the link. I just don't see the need to have both. I could totally be convinced though.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 21:35

@AudraTran I'm not a fan either. It has a warning at the top of the column that tells you that it's not encrypted, but it definitely gives the wrong idea. I don't think you should call it private unless it's REALLY private.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 21:33

@kev Personally, I've always thought having the link card and the URL in the post was redundant. I know I'm about to commit a crime against humanity here, but I kinda like the way Facebook handles that (or did last time I looked). Once the card is generated, you can delete the URL from your post. URLs are treated more like attachments than parts of the text. I guess it's sort of like they're treating hashtags at the end of posts now. Leave inline alone, but just remove the extra characters.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 18:41

@Puma_IT How's this? :joomla:

@fosstodon @joomla

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 18:30

@joel Use the from: option. 😉

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 17:56

4. If you use the Advanced UI, do check out the "Hide Posts From Home" option.

5. Threads should have a slightly different appearance on the web site. It SHOULD be easier to follow.

6. The search will more than likely be out of date at least initially until we can get our index built. Please be patient with us.

Please don't hesitate to ask any of our moderation team if you have questions.

Also, thank you to everybody that has worked so hard to make this release successful.

#Mastodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 17:53

It's here. Fosstodon has been updated to Mastodon 4.2.0. A couple things to note.

1. You have to opt in to be part of the new discoverability features. The setting is in your preferences in Public Profile and under the Privacy and Reach tab.

2. Direct Messages are now called Private Mentions. This doesn't mean they're encrypted. They're not.

3. The Local feed and the Fed have been moved behind Live Feeds, but they're still there.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 15:20

@aktivismoEstasMiaLuo Unfortunately it doesn't have that level of control. At least not in this release.

@chris

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 02:51

@adrianmorales I'm not certain since it's been a long time since I've created a new account, but I think it is default. There are definitely concerns about that if it is.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 02:50

@MyView You won't have to. It's the server's software. Whoever admins your instance will do it for you.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 02:49

@mikey Ahh, good to know. I wonder if that'll get added automatically after the 4.2.0 upgrade or if we're going to have to put that in ourselves. I'll have to follow-up. Thanks!

@jeremystartm

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 00:20

@mikey It can be added there, but it's not standard in Mastodon.

@jeremystartm

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-21 00:17

@seachanger Correct. You know, assuming they release it tomorrow.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-20 20:22

@aktivismoEstasMiaLuo The search states that it's only for Public posts, so changing to any other permission level SHOULD keep it from showing up in searches. I haven't been able to independently verify this, but it makes sense to me at least on a hypothetical level.

@chris

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-20 20:18

@lillyfinch It's a User Interface. It just means you have to login to the web page and make the change to your profile in the preferences there. The mobile applications are going to be a little bit behind, at least to start out with.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-20 20:17

@jeremystartm There was initially some resistance to the feature, so yea there are other Fediverse applications that have had it for a while. I do agree that Mastodon needs an option to at least attempt to keep AIs from harvesting their content, though in a public forum I'm not sure how effective that would be.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-20 20:15

@lillyfinch On the initial release you'll have to make the change in the Web UI, but I expect that the apps will follow shortly. It's opt in, so it won't do it automatically.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-20 19:16

With the impending release of Mastodon 4.2.0, I wanted to highlight the new Public Profile page.

There are several new options here, and they WILL control whether your posts are part of the new full text search. This feature is OPT IN, so if you're wanting your posts to be included, you're going to have to manually give it the thumbs up. If you don't, well, keep on doing what you're doing.

#Mastdon #FullTextSearch

Zeronaut @Zeronaut 2023-09-12 19:59

#developers on #Fosstodon and the FediVerse:
I use #meshcentral as my production RMM in my IT small biz.

The issue's pattern: you have a #cloudflare DNS service routing traffic to your Meshcentral instance, often behind an #nginx reverse proxy. The main website works, but the remote connections start failing half the time. Now they always fail at a 0 sec timeout.

It seems caused by a change in cloudflare likely with #websockets but possibly #ssl certs?
Thoughts on this?
https://github.com/Ylianst/MeshCentral/issues/5302

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-11 17:34

@scifi I've always felt that a #Vivaldi vs #Firefox comparison is like a #KDE vs #Gnome. When I use Firefox, I always feel like I'm constrained. Sure, I can install like 30 extensions and possibly mimic the functionality and customizability of Vivaldi out of the box, but it just becomes a question of "Why?" at that point. There's so much I use in Vivaldi day to day that I just don't know if I could pull of migrating to something else in the long term. A page here or there? Sure.

@veronica

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-11 16:49

@neffscape There are a number of features included that I don't need or use, but there are so many that have become part of my daily workflow that I would be hard pressed to migrate to another browser. I'd have to migrate to another browser and add multiple other apps to compensate. Notes, Reader List, Tiling Tabs, Screen Shots, the Panel. All features I use seamlessly without a thought, that not all other browsers support. I've even custom added buttons like an "Add to Reading List". Love it.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-09-07 02:49

It notified me immediately there were updates, but there was a missing dependency so it wouldn't do them. I manually forced it to #Bookworm, which destroyed the custom UI they've put on it. I reimaged the SDCard, and it's back to good. Tomorrow I try a new image I got a few minutes ago.

Enjoy a faster Vivaldi after a massive #code refactoring 🎉

Our new version on #desktop is now faster, especially when you open a new window⚡️

By rendering browser windows through React portals, we’ve reduced #memory usage, and significantly improved overall #performance.

Whether you use #Shortcuts, Menus, or Quick Commands, the portal-aware functionality ensures a noticeable increase in #speed when opening a new window 🏃

More about Vivaldi 6.2 👇

@hund @rgggn @Linuxkompis @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-27 18:25

@graywolf Yes, but the intent isn't for just everyday things that one instance may allow that ours doesn't. Different instances allow for different things, and that's how it should be in a distributed social network. It's more for things like blatant racism, calling for the death of an ethnic group, posting illicit images of minors, etc. We don't want to make a list because inevitably someone will go and do something outside of that list and claim that it wasn't against our CoC.

@fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-26 19:01

@indie1337_1@vivaldi.net It's been trying for sure. I've been putting in so much time here that I'm not sure I did anything beyond show up at my real job. Thankfully they're both online and my work can only tell that I'm there and active. They can't see what I'm actively working on. Feels like can't even move without someone stirring up a hornet's nest about some random thing. Just exhausting.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-26 18:58

@karrot We did it through the official Announcement process on the via the web interface, but I'm now wondering if some people are using clients that might not support that feature.

@kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-26 18:57

@karrot Yep, Fosstodon Announcement said:

Following a discussion with our patrons, the policy requiring posts to be in English on Fosstodon has been removed. The moderation team will utilize available translation technologies for moderation purposes. However, we may request community support for languages not supported by our translation software, or where context isn't well understood. We appreciate your patience as we incorporate this change into our moderation practices.

@kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-25 19:22

@achevallier I apologize for the delayed response to your appeal. The reason it has taken so long to respond is there was an active poll to our Patrons regarding a rule. Historically, Fosstodon has been English Only. I'm not sure why your posts were flagged as spam, but they would have been reportable under the English Only rule anyway. The results of the poll have come in, and our Patrons wish to remove that rule, so you're the first to know. The reason for the action has been removed.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-25 17:44

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-25 16:04

@vaurora I'm starting to feel that the whole CoC could use a good revamp to improve on multiple things, including trying to clarify what these rules mean. It seems like our CoC was written by rank amateurs, but in our defense that's only because we are rank amateurs.

@StephanieZvan @dalias @musl

@vaurora I've saved the response from @StephanieZvan and I've read it multiple times. Still working out how best to implement her advice for our community.

Regarding the English Only Rule, two days ago we put up a poll to our Patreons to ask them how they would like us to proceed. It's got 3 hours left, but so far it looks like the English Only rule is soon to be retired. We'll be updating the CoC to reflect that as soon as the poll ends.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 20:11

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 19:08

@nic Nope, the rule has only ever applied to OPs, and not replies or boosts. Further, only posts where the privacy level was set to Public. This was a reply to an Unlisted post. Everything would be in the green.

@fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 19:05

@keefeglise I don't know for certain obviously, but my expectation is we're going to need to spend more time on moderation and we're going to spend more money on tools. We're going to need more people, and we're going to spend more time finding and training people willing to work for free. Judging by the trend on our current poll on Patreon, we're probably going to find out. Hopefully I'm wrong.

@kev @fosstodon @nic @lulu_powerful

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 18:56

@keefeglise How much more I'm not sure. That will depend entirely on how much it's used. Right now we self host, and if it becomes yet another thing to track and update and monitor, it might be more worth investing in a service. We've been considering it even prior to recent events. I have every expectation that cost would at least double even sticking to our current configuration. I don't foresee our current configuration being workable long-term though.

@kev @fosstodon @nic @lulu_powerful

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 18:52

@keefeglise There's also a software angle. We provide a translation tool integrated into Fosstodon, but that's not an actual part of the Mastodon software. It's a 3rd party tool integrated in. The way Mastodon handles translation is actually pretty terrible. Our existing setup may not be able to handle the extra load from local timeline translations. Honestly it barely covers it now, and most people don't seem to know it exists. That WILL mean more money.

@kev @fosstodon @nic @lulu_powerful

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 18:49

@keefeglise I don't know how far into this answer you'd like me to go, but some things to consider are the extra time investment for our team. I already spend almost as much time working on Fosstodon related activities as I do for my day job. Is our current team even capable of handling the potential extra load? We may need to bring more moderators in, which means time spent vetting potential candidates, training (yes we do that), and initial burn-in.

@kev @fosstodon @nic @lulu_powerful

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 18:47

@keefeglise How much would the cost rise? I don't mean this answer to be snarky, but that's an easy question to ask and not an easy one to answer. Monetarily speaking, it wouldn't. None of our moderation staff are paid for their time, and that includes @kev and myself, so it wouldn't cost us anything extra. Of course, there are other non-monetary considerations, and those are much harder to quantify, especially since everything is hypothetical at this juncture.

@fosstodon @nic @lulu_powerful

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 16:27

@jeffmcneill I'll look into getting that done. Thank you for the suggestion.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-24 16:27

@vaurora I appreciate your advice. I kinda feel this might be what it's like to win a Razzie Award. The clause for debating moderator action has been removed from our CoC. We've also added a section to our CoC regarding behavior outside of Fosstodon, though the wording could really use some work. We've been struggling with how to convey what our intentions are in that regard. I have a question about the "past behavior" portion. How do you avoid the impression of rug pulling?

@dalias @musl

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-23 22:24

@jla I have not. I'm not sure what it is, but I'll look it up. Thanks for the suggestion!

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-23 19:47

https://www.patreon.com/fosstodon

Mike Stone boosted
Cedric @cedric 2023-08-21 20:27

#Instagram users should just switch to #Pixelfed. Seriously. The UI of Pixelfed is lighter and works very well without being authenticated (no login popup, etc.).

With a small user base (compared to IG), everytime I post the same photo on Pixelfed and IG, I get way more views (and comments !) on Pixelfed.It's quite fun. And the comments are really nice. The goal is not to spam my account.

#ActivityPub #fediverse

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-21 22:37

I know people complain about @Vivaldi being not fully open and being based on #Chromium, but you just can't beat #Vivaldi when it comes to features. I read a lot on the Internet, but sometimes I just don't have the time to do it right now. Vivaldi has an integrated #ReadingList which I can just add my current page to with relative ease. To make it easier, I created a #CommandChain to add the current tab to the Reading List and then close it. I put that chain on my toolbar with a custom icon.

@dalias @musl The rule you're referencing is there to avoid having every decision made by our moderation team relitigated in the public timeline. Whether or not an individual is a member of the LGBTQ+ community is not a factor in moderation decisions unless that individual is being targeted in any way. If the individual you're referring to is the one I think it is, they were warned multiple times for spam and only suspended after they publicly attacked our moderation team.

As far as I am aware, r000t hasn't violated our Code of Conduct, and there haven't been any recent reports. We've recently updated our CoC to let the community know we do consider activity on other instances in some cases, but we're not going back retroactively and suspending for past incidents.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 17:44

@Joseph_of_Earth numbers are different/higher, but the theshold to get on the list seems fairly low.

The Hashtags and Links are more of a list than a series of posts, so they're a little different I think. They require continued activity over a 48 hour period, so the bar is constantly moving. It even give us a line graph for hashtags if you look at the individual page for one. That one is a weird one actually and I probably should look at it closer. It says 48 hours on the front 2/

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 17:40

The Posts just work like another timeline, but I'm not sure what the threshold is for showing up there. The Trending section of the Admin pages gives shows me 38 pages of posts that are currently "Trending" with the last one in the list only having been "Shared and favourited 5 times." Looking at the actual post those 1/

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 16:55

@graywolf I think we're going to have to expand that section with some clarifying language. There's been a lot of questions/concern about it, when really it's just to protect our team.

@fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 16:48

@graywolf It does say that it COULD include. There's a reason the Federated Accounts section is separate from the Rules. We're not going to chase people around the Fed. That's not our goal. This section is to protect our team if we find there's a person following our CoC with an account on Fosstodon, but who have another (verifiable) account elsewhere doing something "bad". We're not talking naughty language, but CSAM or calling for the eradication of a racial group type stuff.

@fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 16:36

@Joseph_of_Earth #randomhashtaghere, but #RandomHashtagHere. That's about it. We do generally filter hashtags that aren't English since we're an English only instance, but speaking for myself I'm not sure we need to be doing that. I don't know how I'd fix the case for those kind of posts so they'd probably be broken for visually impaired members of the community.

Sorry for the wall of text, but I hope that answered your question. 3/3

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 16:34

@Joseph_of_Earth While we CAN do that, we generally DON'T. We could pick and choose what shows up there, but that would require investigation into each link and each post. That's a TON of time spent, and I don't think any of us have it to spare. I'm not sure it would be something our community would WANT us to do if we did. We DO "edit" the hashtags that appear there, but only so far as to adjust the case to make it more legible or work with screen reader software. So not 2/

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 16:32

@Joseph_of_Earth Well, we keep #Fosstodon as close to vanilla as possible to avoid issues with upgrades and maintenance, so the HOW things show up is identical to vanilla. What we see from an Admin perspective is 3 categories. We see hashtags, posts, and links. These are all things that are just getting traction in the Fed. Our moderation team can "overrule" a hashtag, link, or post if we find the content inappropriate, so a bot can't take advantage and spam the Explore section. 1/

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 14:23

@graywolf We don't care if you're posting adult content on another instance, assuming it's not something illegal. The change in the CoC is just to prevent Fosstodon from being treated as a sanctuary while posting material on another instance that maybe illegal or reprehensible. For instance, following our CoC here but on another instance posting highly racist content can still get your account suspended here.

@fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-11 03:37

@JoeRess I didn't miss it, because a new episode of 2.5 Admins just showed up in my existing feed with no added cost to me! It's like magic!

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-04 02:53

@giantspacesquid You can rest assured, your blue checkmark will always be worth exactly as much as you paid for it!

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 19:25

@adamsdesk Yea, things can get pretty weird because of how the translations work. If you take the link you provided and click on it, it opens the post on mamot.fr and there's no translation option. If you take the same link and paste it into the search box on Fosstodon, it'll bring up the "Fosstodon version" of the post, and there will be a translation option because we do have a translation service. :blobcatgooglyshrug:

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:41

@samvarma Yea, search is a whole other ball of wax that has a lot of complexity to it because of the defederated nature of the Fediverse. It's really cool how all these different platforms all work together and communicate but it does create some challenges too. Hopefully they'll come up with a solution to the search thing here soon.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:38

@adamsdesk Translations is an area where Mastodon could use a lot of work. There's a bunch of reasons you might not be seeing a translate link. Instances handle their own translation. It's not built into the Mastodon software, so a 3rd party service is required. If one isn't configured, no translations. mamot.fr doesn't seem to have one. Otherwise, individuals have to specify their language correctly too. Languages aren't autodetected. They can have a post labeled English when it's Spanish.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:35

@fredonline I think that's pretty much up to you how you want to put it in your profile. I don't think that having hashtags in your profile really helps with discoverability as I've never seen a profile come up in a search because of them. I could be wrong. That's not something I've ever done any research on.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:31

@levischuck I expect they're refocusing more on Bard and the shift has caused some behind the scenes problems. If I were to guess, I'd say that these issues are probably temporary until they can completely integrate the old Assistant features into the Bard codebase, but who knows? There's been less focus on Assistants since they realized it's not a big money maker for them. Still, things that were working shouldn't stop if they're not making backend changes.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:28

@vjprema I still have my Mark2 handily chugging along. It's configured to work with my Home Assistant. It's running Neon these days instead of the classic #Mycroft since the company is pretty much just one guy these days. Not sure how long that's going to last. That's really the biggest barrier to open voice assistants. They just don't have a viable hardware option. Amazon and Google have poisoned the well by offering their devices at next to nothing.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:26

@tcely I like Trunks, that's a pretty cool UI. I might have to spend some more time there.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:22

@thrashcardiom Well, Google has given many reasons to have little trust in them.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:21

@shom @amolith It seems like there's some disagreement on whether it should be gated or not. I'd rather not have lists of hashtags (even pretty versions) showing up after posts. I'd rather have it in an expandable space that I can view if I so choose. Others would rather have it visible all the time. This sounds like a perfect opportunity for a configurable option. I'd probably default to visibility, but allow for them to be hidden so people like me don't go nuts.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:17

@HarkMahlberg Yea, I think that's going to be a more subjective element of the feature. I prefer the hashtags coming at the end rather than the original mockup since it kinda takes them out of the way for me. I also like the PR version includes the inline hashtags in the list, rather than have hashtags show up in multiple places. That feels cleaner to me in the long run.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-03 17:11

@samvarma I like the idea of stripping the hash off the word but including it as a hashtag in a collapsible list after the post. I would assume that the hashlist would be configurable by the individual, so if you want to see it by default and I don't, both would be options. I've always felt like treating hashtags as links and leaving the # was extraneous, and especially since Mastodon (and Twitter) doesn't currently allow inline linking. That might cause confusion if that feature is ever added.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 23:16

This is an interesting read by @kissane that I think is worth spending some time on. It's worth taking a step back and considering what we can learn from the experiences of the people she talked to. What can we take away from their personal experiences to help us improve the experiences of others in the future?

https://erinkissane.com/mastodon-is-easy-and-fun-except-when-it-isnt

#Mastodon
#Onboarding

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 23:07

@giantspacesquid My understanding is, maybe? The default behavior would just be to separate hashtag lists people end their posts with into a distinct section to improve how things look. It may actually IMPROVE visibility because those hashtags would be separated and highlighted. There was talk of allowing the ability to hide those tag lists at the end of the posts, which may clean things farther, but create at least one (potentially several) extra steps to access those tags.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 23:00

@proactiveservices Well, to be fair there's definitely some "dogpile Gargron" in there too.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 22:57

@proactiveservices I think that's probably Gargron's fault. He just recently changed the title of the PR. Originally it was "Change hashtags at the end of the post to not be rendered", and he only recently changed it to "Change hashtags at the end of the post to render out-of-band". Virtually all the comments are from before that change, so I can see where people may have gotten the wrong idea.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 22:34

I'm kinda on the fence about this feature right now. I can see where it would clean up the appearance of some posts. I'm not a dev on it or anything (or on anything else really), but I'm curious what your thoughts are.

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26260

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 22:27

@stefan I've never looked too closely at it to be honest.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 18:38

I feel like this could be an opportunity for a more open option. Both Google and Amazon have seemingly lost some of their focus on this market because it turns out people aren't just going to ask their voice assistant to buy them something and trust that it's just all going to work out. An open option like #Neon or #OVOS could step in and cover the basic functions. Unfortunately with the demise of #Mycroft, there's no hardware to run it on other than PCs or the #Mark2.

https://www.computerworld.com/article/3703729/whats-going-on-with-google-assistant.html

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 17:58

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-02 17:56

@shom Ha! No, wasn't fishing, just commentary on how things have changed as Fosstodon has gotten larger. Thank you though!

@benjaminhollon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-01 18:37

@shom I used to pretty much spend all my time on the local timeline. I'm still pretty proud of it, and when I'm browsing I'm either on the local timeline or in one of my curated columns (the advanced UI is gold imho). Sadly, most of my time on Fosstodon is administrative these days, and i'm mucking around in the admin pages approving accounts or handling reports. I still love my time here, but it's not the carefree fun it used to be for sure.

@benjaminhollon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-01 17:12

@ericjmorey @benjaminhollon Yea, trending posts could be a decent compromise.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-01 17:11

@benjaminhollon Mastodon USED to have the feature where admins could set certain accounts to be automatically followed, but that's since been replaced with accounts to recommend.

Fosstodon has gotten to be pretty large lately. I first joined Mastodon on mastodon.rocks in 2016 (I think?), and I don't recall how busy the home timeline was at the time. I wasn't there super long before jumping over to Fosstodon. Even at its present size I'm not sure the local timeline would be intimidating.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-01 16:43

@benjaminhollon Solid point. There's valid criticisms for every approach here. If you don't start out with something, your timeline is empty when you start. If you start out with a public timeline you can be overwhelmed. If you start out with an "interest" list, you have to answer a bunch of personal questions just to get into a social network you probably don't know a ton about. None of those approaches are perfect.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-01 16:19

@benjaminhollon Yea, I can't see that would be a major barrier. I think it would be kind of cool to have a client that shows you a timeline before you even have to create an account. You fire up the app and it's giving you content. If you want to post/follow you need to register with an instance obviously, but until then you can still read. It would be a trivial feature to add even if you're just going to assume mastodon.social.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-01 16:08

@benjaminhollon I'm honestly not sure. There's multiple ways to tackle that functionality, and even I can pull off a moderately workable solution in so few lines of code it fits into a post. I can't believe that an actual COMPETENT programmer couldn't pull off something significantly better with minimal effort in a half an hour.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-08-01 15:58

I'm a garbage #Python programmer, and even I can pull this off.

import requests, json, re

def strip_html(text):
pattern = re.compile(r"<.*?>", re.DOTALL)
return pattern.sub("", text)

i = "https://fosstodon.org/api/v1/timelines/public"
m = requests.get(i)
d = json.loads(m.content)

for x in d:
dat = x["account"]
txt = x["content"]
print (dat["display_name"] + " (" + dat["acct"] + "):")
print (strip_html(txt))
print("-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-")

Maybe I'm getting to far into the "get off my lawn" territory, but I don't claim I have a TV show because I can upload video of myself to YouTube.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-27 11:41

One of the downsides to working in a large company.

You're paged just after 2 in the morning because something is broken. It's not something you can fix, so you call another person. They look at it, and if you're lucky they get a little farther (not this time). Then they have to call another person. If you're lucky they keep you in the loop. Maybe someone else gets called? You don't know cause no one is updating you. Now it's almost 5 in the morning, no sleep, and you're staring at your feet.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-26 15:46

@jannem @gotanda It's a feature of Mastodon to use external translation services. So, it's not TECHNICALLY built in to Mastodon, but it's supported. We self host a LibreTranslate instance, which is where our costs come from. The server is under powered for what it's doing, so sometimes the translation services are a little spotty. Whether an instance has a translation service is up to the individual admins, so not all of them provide it, and not all of the Mastodon apps use it if it's there.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-26 15:41

@TheFreePenguin The developers changed it. We basically conform to vanilla Mastodon, so we got that change too.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-23 20:39

@pixel translations that are built into Mastodon. Mastodon isn't really great with that stuff yet. Translations specifically are pretty terrible. If you post in Ukrainian but tell Mastodon it's in Spanish, the translation link will try to translate it from Spanish to whichever language the individual uses. If that's Spanish already, they won't get the option to translate at all. I know it's an extra step, but it would be appreciated by more than just me if you could specify your language. 2/2

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-23 20:37

@pixel Hey, I wanted to let you know we recently received a report on some of your posts. The posts in question were non-English, but you'd kept them Unlisted or they were replies to other people, so fully in compliance with our CoC, so I closed the report without taking any action on it. No warnings or anything like that. I did want to mention that I noticed that despite them being non-English posts, the posts themselves still reported they were English. This can mess up filters and 1/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-19 16:41

@pango @RyuKurisu Yep, exactly. Instead of 1 10MB file (for example), you'd end up with 12 files that are 1MB each. You get around the 5MB (random number here) size limitation just by sending each file separately.

#CheatingTheSystem

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-19 03:37

@RyuKurisu Ya, but 20 (30?) plus years ago people would use the -m option to break up large binary files into multiple ASCII files. You could specify the chunk size at the command line. People would probably use split to do the same thing these days. That way you could post large binary files to text based services like NNTP and recombine them later. There's much better ways of doing this now (hence the joke), but it was pretty popular in some circles back in the day.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-18 22:39

Coworker1: We have to send it through protocol 1 because there's a file size limitation on protocol 2.

Me (joking): Or we could just uuencode -m the files.

Coworker1: <blank look>

Coworker2: <blank look>

Coworker3: <blank look>

Me (not joking): I'm SO much older than I thought I was.

The longest stretch of consecutive days with lows 90 degrees and above.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-15 05:10

@wraptile Oh, it's on my wish list for my birthday. I would LOVE to see markdown support. At least a subset would be amazing. I'd even settle for the bold and italics. It's been a request for literally years.

@omenos @kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-15 05:04

@omenos Well, it's not outside the realm of possibility, but not something we're planning on in the immediate future. Unfortunately the standard post length isn't part of the front end configuration, and requires a little more hands on in the back end of things. It complicates upgrades. Because of that, we've elected to stay at the standard 500 characters. IF (and this would have to come down from on high) it became part of the front end config, I'd totally be onboard.

@downey @aral

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-13 05:57

@jens Thought I was pretty clear that Mastodon sends out notifications via email. We don't have email addresses for remote accounts. No email address, no notification. This isn't something unique or special about Fosstodon. It's how Mastodon works as a whole.

@downey @aral

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-13 05:49

@jens Michael Downey's account was blocked last November. I don't know what the reason for that is because all of the information found in the multiple reports gets wiped with the rest of his data after the grace period expires (that grace period is defined by the Mastodon software and not something configured and determined by us). If anybody had reached out at the time, I'd have been happy to explain.

@downey @aral

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-13 05:47

@jens Does this reflect our policy? Yes, everybody is subject to the same CoC on Fosstodon, regardless of whether they're @downey, @aral, or someone you care less about.

Remote accounts get less notice as Mastodon sends notifications via email and email addresses are not part of the information instances exchange.

Aral's account was limited in January due to several reports of him personally attacking other individuals, including telling them to F off and calling them "pricks".

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-13 00:05

@dusoft Some of them are due to a resource issue, which can be fixed by upgrading the server translation runs on. Unfortunately, the same error gets generated if someone tries to translate to or from an unsupported language. To fix that, we'd need to use a different product entirely. That's not out of the question, but it's a little bit more of an effort.

@fosstodon

Quite honestly, none of this is new. Fosstodon is almost 6 years old now. Moderation has occurred in that time. If you have questions about any of that moderation, feel free to ask. I'll answer to the best of my ability.

@ttiurani

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-12 21:18

@blake Who is considered "prominent" is entirely subjective, and we're not going to put up a notification every time we block an account. How would you suggest we solve this problem?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-12 21:11

@blake There's no rogue mod/admin that I'm aware of. We use the moderation tools available to us, which are the same tools all moderators have at their disposal. Notifications of actions on reports are sent via email, so if you're part of the community here at Fosstodon, you'll get an email notification of any action regarding your account. Email addresses are not part of the information instances exchange (that's good), so we don't email remote individuals. I'd be surprised if any anyone does.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-12 21:07

@joel What would you like to know?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-08 23:52

@Twashe No one is federating with Threads yet. The option isn't available even if you want it. Whether we will in the future is still an open question. Meta is an unscrupulous data miner, and there's a ton of reasons to not trust a single thing they do. On the other hand, Mastodon (Fosstodon specifically) is a public forum. No account is required to read posts here, and pretty much anything Meta could glean from our federation with them can also be gleaned by hosting a covert Mastodon instance.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-08 23:45

@blake Really? Are these posts coming from floss.social, or someone on their behalf?

We're fully aware of the trepidation regarding our use of #Cloudflare, and we're currently working on migrating over to #Fastly instead.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-07 19:36

@isaacrlevin I approved your appeal, but this is not the 2nd time you've been reported, it's the 6th. People are not fans of the link shortener as it obfuscates the destination of the link. Add to that other parties have used link shorteners in nefarious ways in the past, and people don't trust them.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-05 22:40

@Nenad Depends on how involved you want to get, and how much of a financial contribution you're wanting to make. I used to use https://write.as for my personal blog. It's a hosted service that uses markdown for blog formatting. You can add your own CSS if you're inclined, and for a modest charge you can configure your own domain name and join the Fediverse. I left the old blog out there if you're looking for an example of a bare bones setup.

https://write.as/mikestone/

@kev and I have no plans to standup further services at this point. I won't say it's impossible in the future, but I wouldn't wait around if you're wanting to move off your existing solution.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-04 16:49

@MariaLiv Well, it's possible to have your own instance, and connect to our instance, but instances are distinct from each other, so I don't know of a way to have one under another.

masto.host is a great option if you're looking to have your own instance. I can't recommend them highly enough.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-03 17:26

@iambozdar Welcome! Yea, because there's no algorithm filling your timelines for you, things can be pretty sparse when you first join. I'd suggest checking out the local timeline as there's a lot of activity there, and also you'll notice if you search for hashtags that there's the ability to follow them and not just individuals. Doing a quick search for hashtags that match your interests can fill up your feed pretty quickly. We're a pretty friendly bunch too, so don't hesitate to ask questions.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-03 04:40

@tkk13909 It was a really surreal experience when one of the episodes was about an event involving a company I worked for during that time. It was interested comparing what we knew internally to the company and what our executives were telling us vs. what was made public and what actually happened.

@JoeRess

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-03 04:26

@JoeRess Great show. I've been enjoying watching more and more people move to Mastodon for years and years. It used to be that no one even had heard of Mastodon, but just last week during a meeting at my kid's school while listening to one of the teachers drone on about something, I saw one of the other parents pull out her phone, fire up Mastodon, scroll a bit, reply to something, and then put her phone back in her pocket. It's not going to be an overnight thing, but it's a thing.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-03 02:52

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-01 21:18

@aaronmccollum @mrtysn Thanks! I think a lot of people assume that we don't read them. A lot of the reasons for joining are single words or a period or some random filler stuff. Most of those accounts don't get approved since we ARE reading them and we DO have things we look for when we do. It keeps us busy. 😉

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-01 21:15

@MariaLiv Welcome! Since the account is remote there's nothing that we can really do. You could contact the admin over there and ask it be deleted, but I'd suggest not. I generally advise people to leave their old accounts because it contains your posts and people can use it to find your new account. Plus, if for whatever reason you're not happy with your move, those old accounts can be reactivated and you can resume using it. If you delete it, that account is lost for good.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-01 20:43

@stardust Well, it's by someone's design I'm sure. We stick to vanilla Mastodon defaults wherever we can to ease updates and keep things as stable as possible. That's something that came down from on high from the Mastodon developers, not a conscious choice by us.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-01 20:40

@niqwithq Happy to have you!

@kev

@kev @fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2023-07-01 20:39

@mrtysn Welcome! Just so you know, no they don't auto-accept. Yes, we go through each one manually and yes, it's a lot of work. :blobcatwink:

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-30 19:25

@matthartley Hm, still haven't gotten the email. I'm super curious now. 😉

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-30 16:36

@cooper I'm still using my Gen 1. 😉

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-29 16:17

@txwikinger Just a reply to your question about non-English languages. No, you don't need a different account. We don't expect people to always speak English in every single post. We just ask if you're posting to the public timeline that you do so in English. If you posted the English version of your post first, that would have been fine. If you changed the permissions to Unlisted or Followers Only, that's fine. Replies and direct messages don't have to be in English. Just the Public timeline.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-29 00:05

It sounded really interesting, and even though I've managed to resist the urge to buy one just for that, if you have one already it could be a fun use for it.

https://linuxmatters.sh/4/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-28 04:28

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-27 18:11

Microsoft wants to stream your OS to you. Ignoring the whole "Microsoft" angle on this, I personally hate this idea. I miss the days when a computer was a standalone device that COULD connect to the Internet, but didn't have to. These days, so many things DEPEND on having that connection, and just flat out won't work without it. Maybe I'm a stodgy old guy, but can't we go back? I want my computer to with exactly the same online or offline.

https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/27/23775117/microsoft-windows-11-cloud-consumer-strategy

I'd like to see most of the people using it migrate over to Lemmy or kbin. Both seem like they have the potential to carry this torch. Just need the population to make it a reality.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-13 17:50

I sometimes think back on college and wonder how I knew so much more then than now. It seems backwards.

Then, I get a request from work to do a simple code deploy. I login to the server in another state from my computer at home, run the script that I wrote that automatically pulls DB code from GitHub and logs into our DB server to execute it. I verify the output log making sure everything worked, and update the Jira ticket with the results.

Easy stuff, but I couldn't do that in college.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-02 21:20

@isaacrlevin One thing that could really help is adding a bit of commentary to your posts. Fosstodon is for people who are interested in technology and FOSS (hence the name), so the content itself is good, but why did you think it was interesting enough to post? Anybody can read the article, but what did you think about it? That inspires conversation, and that's good. I know for a lot of people (not sure if you're one of them) that's outside their comfort zone, but it really helps engaging.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-06-02 21:14

@isaacrlevin Hey, I saw and approved your appeal earlier, but I wanted to mention why you got reported and why the moderator took the action they did. There were 2 things that put it on our radar. One, it's an auto poster. That's fine in and of itself, but there's little to no other interaction with the instance. The account comes across as being unmonitored. Two, the lion's share of your posts use a URL shortener pointing to your own domain. That sets off "spammer" alarm bells for many here.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-30 16:56

@BrideOfLinux An uncomfortably large amount actually. We're in the middle of a large project that has daily tasks that are sizable. No wiggle room on those. Any delays impact the subsequent days in adverse ways. Monday wasn't compensated for by the PM, so I've got two days of tasks to complete today. Not going to be fun.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-30 16:50

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-30 03:02

@RL_Dane No, not at this time. If something drastic were to happen like Eugen sells Mastodon to Google or something equally crazy, we would look into it, but as long as everything is sane, we're going to stick to as vanilla Mastodon as possible.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-30 02:40

@RL_Dane It is and it isn't. Right now, Mastodon doesn't include the character limit as a configurable option, so to increase it we have to make changes to the backend files. All those changes need to be reapplied manually after every single update. Because of that we've avoided it. IF, and I don't know if it's in their roadmap, the ability to increase that limit moves to the frontend, @kev and I would more than likely have a vote on what the majority would prefer. That's a big if at this point.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-27 05:35

@Kaitalyn I'm not feeling sad, but I'm going to have ice cream anyway.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-27 05:34

@adamsdesk of that generated work matches prior work. What kind of automated system excels at analyzing massive quantities of data quickly? I bet you can guess. Neither solution sounds great. Any dark line we draw will be an arbitrary selection. It's hard to argue for 3 when 2 and 4 are both so close to the exact same thing. Equally, the same questions come up with a model to determine if something AI generated as came up with the AI model in the first place. Such a weird problem. 3/3

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-27 05:30

@adamsdesk and that's when things get REALLY stupid. When it comes to an automated system generating massive amounts of text/images/video/whatever, we're going to rely on internal checks. How do we do that? We either draw a dark black line SOMEWHERE in there where 2 lines of code matching is fine, but 3 is a copyright violation (as an example, not to be taken literally), or we're going to have to use some automated system to compare what the AI generates to existing work to see if TOO much 2/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-27 05:28

@adamsdesk I wouldn't go so far as to say useless. I think we have to treat AI like we do people. Just like I can't credit every source of inspiration I have for everything I write (even for something as short as this reply), we can't expect an AI to worry about attribution for every single word. License will have to work with a gradient approach. Entire code blocks of replicated code would be a license violation (just as it would be for a human). The question becomes where to draw the line, 1/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 22:06

@indie1337@vivaldi.net 😆

An age old question finally answered!

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 22:03

@indie1337@vivaldi.net It's like that old joke, why'd the goose cross the road?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 21:37

@adamsdesk can hope is that I've accurately conveyed just how confusing this whole subject is for me. There's a lot of gray area and literal philosophy going on in there (Ship of Theseus anybody?). I don't think we're ever going to get to a place where everybody agrees on all of it. 4/4

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 21:35

@adamsdesk The MORE original what you've written is, the more likely it will be replicated specifically. Example, if I ask you to write Hello World in Python, the code you'd write wouldn't be significantly different than the code millions of other people have written when doing the same thing. The more complex and unique the request, the smaller the sampled data set the LLM has to work with, so the more likely it is it will replicate a specific thing. That's bad.

So, three posts in and all 3/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 21:33

@adamsdesk in the first place is a little bit more cut and dry. If I read your blog and I learn something from it or internalize a phrase that you've used in your post, I haven't "stolen" anything from you. I don't see where a language model reading your blog post and using that data would be different. Honestly, the data they get from it is even more abstract that what I would.

Of course, there's an interesting caveat to all of this too, and that's rarity. Rarity creates odd circumstances. 2/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 21:25

@adamsdesk I think the legal stuff is going to be a constant question that never really has a good answer. These LLMs are just really big probability engines tacking words together that statistically make sense. We all do that same thing in our head every time we write a sentence. The question boils down to how much can the LLM tack together that matches what I tacked together before it violates my intellectual property. I've got no good answers.

I think the question of training the model 1/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 19:33

@adamsdesk I'm not opposed to a "Copilot" on a purely abstract level. I can see where an OS based assistant would be a benefit for people who don't want to be computer people and just want to do specific tasks. The OS of a computer SHOULD be invisible in my opinion. I'm NOT a fan of Microsoft or Google being the ones in charge of that copilot though. If it doesn't work correctly air gapped, it's wrong IMHO.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-26 18:51

@lns Yes. From the planet. Possibly farther. Eww. 😉

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-24 01:48

@pixelherodev I think we've been trying that method for as long as I've been alive with extremely mixed results. How many things that would also be good for the environment aren't being done because of high energy costs? Desalination of sea water to increase clean water supplies? AeroFarms for increased food production? Etc. Advancements that sit basically idle because they take too much energy to accomplish at scale?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-24 01:23

@pixelherodev I disagree, first and foremost because we use a finite amount. We can cut back, but how far we can cut back without living in caves is limited by practicality. We need to increase supply in a clean and efficient manner. This isn't to say that cutting back usage isn't important, but it's only a short term solution. We can't treat it like it's going to solve our problems in the long term.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-24 01:03

@pixelherodev It's only waste if something of value isn't gotten from its use, and "value" is a very subjective position. That's especially true when what's being "wasted" is in infinite supply.

I don't disagree with your assessment of our current energy market, but I do think that this step may be necessary to get us to a position where we no longer require nonrenewable energy sources.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-24 00:55

@benjaminradio Assistive technology is the the most interesting area of exploration for me. I lost my mom a few years back to Alzheimer's, and there's a list of things that a sufficiently advanced AI could have eased in her life. Of course, the technology wasn't there. It still isn't, but advances are being made, and I'd just like to make sure the advances being made are beneficial for everybody and not locked behind artificial walls.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-24 00:51

@pixelherodev It seems like you're still more concerned with where the energy is coming from rather than its usage. If (hypothetically) we invented perpetual motion tomorrow and were able to supply every person in the world with as much clean, renewable energy as they could use, would the amount of energy being used still matter? I think the answer is no. The amount of energy we use is only unethical due to how it's produced and it's unequal distribution.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-23 20:05

@pixelherodev Energy consumption is an interesting conundrum. Using nonrenewable energy wastefully is unethical in my mind. I have less concerns about using renewables. IF (and that's a big if) the models for Stable Diffusion or GPT 4 (or similar) were created in a datacenter powered entirely by renewable energy, I'd have less problems with it.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-23 19:56

@pixelherodev This is a sticking point for me with AI. I don't mind AI. I like it actually, but I don't like it when a few select entities control it. Microsoft and Google fighting over the collective future of AI is disturbing. I like seeing versions of the latest GPT software that will run locally. I like seeing a version of Stable Diffusion running locally. I understand that not everybody is going to want to do that, and it would be wasteful if they did. Maye decentralization to the rescue?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-23 18:43

@keydelk Yea, I feel like corporations should be concerned with this. At a recent meeting with our C-Level executives, our CTO cautioned against uploading proprietary data into ChatGPT and Bard. Soon it's not going to matter because the AI is going to be built in to everything we use anyway. You know, unless they want to migrate everybody to Linux. I wouldn't hate that.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-23 18:22

#Microsoft looks like it's going to be building it's tool called #Windows #Copilot directly into their OS. They're also including a Copilot in Office and Edge. Basically all Microsoft products will have a built in "assistant". If you're concerned about AI having access to your data, it's going to be much more difficult to avoid in the near future. Adding to the concern is this is black box AI. It's not open. We have no idea what's going on inside that digital head.

https://www.cnet.com/tech/computing/windows-copilot-puts-ai-in-the-middle-of-microsofts-most-important-software/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-21 06:05

@karambir Will do. I have only created the most basic of automations with it so far. The LEDs on the device itself can be controlled, so I setup some automations to turn the light on when it detects the room is occupied and off when it detects it's not. It's been interesting because it works much farther away than I expected. I placed it on the far wall of my living room (which has a vaulted ceiling) and it detects people walking around upstairs all the way across the room and one floor up.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-21 05:43

@karambir I just got the 1 to kind of test it out. I've only set it up today, so I haven't been able to fully put it through its paces yet, but so far it's been really great. Assuming things continue to go as well, I could see myself buying more.

The connectivity is good. The setup is stupidly easy, and the only glitch I ran into was I screwed up the case on a letter in the name of my AP, so the setup initially failed. When I put the correct information in, everything worked like a charm.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-20 23:50

Just got a EP1 setup in my Home Assistant. This thing is really cool. It literally detects me breathing. It's got some pretty wide ranging sensors in it too, not just presence detection. It has temperature, humidity, illuminance. Just so many options. Really solid bit of hardware. My only complaint about it is the wall mount is 3d printed, and it's cracked already after only a few hours. I'll probably use adhesive strips to mount to the wall anyway, but still.

https://shop.everythingsmart.io/en-us/collections/everything-presence-one

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-15 17:54

@LinuxClaude We're good. There's a slight detail that's incorrect in the statement "if someone posts to a hashtag and nobody from my instance follows that person the post will not show up in my hashtag search." It's not the individual, but the instance. Someone on Fosstodon would need to follow someone on the instance, not the individual in particular. Fosstodon is large enough and been around long enough that it knows about the vast majority of instances.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-13 21:04

@sixpounder I've talked to enough call center reps who are only following a script and have no real understanding of what they're "supporting" to know we're already at a place where a language model could replace rooms full of people. They're using it to take orders in drive-thrus already. Long term, a server in a datacenter is cheaper than salary and benefits for a person, and you never have to worry about sick days or burnout.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-13 20:36

@0xDEADBEEF @tulpa That's not far off. It really just needs to be rethought and rewritten, but since it's already in place and working(ish), no one wants to do it or put time into it. It's a little selfish of me too since I'm the one usually fixing it.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-12 21:17

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-12 21:16

@tulpa Around 2000 I worked for a company where I did a lot of manual junk. I thought the process was stupid, so I wrote a series of scripts to make my life easier. I didn't mention them to anybody because I honestly didn't even think about it. One day my boss saw me run one and she basically said, "What was THAT!". I explained what I had done, and she was thrilled. My whole job turned into maintaining and updating those scripts for the department. Trust me, this isn't my first rodeo.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-12 20:58

There's something cathartic about getting assigned an estimated 10 hours of work and, instead of doing it you spend 30 minutes writing a script that does it all for you in seconds. You push a couple buttons and all that work just disappears.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-12 17:48

@RyuKurisu Our schedule deploy windows are Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7PM to 11PM. Fridays are generally bad because resources to resolve issues are harder to reach so outages that would be more quickly resolved take longer and impact more people. This Friday release is what we consider "off-cycle", and is typically at the request of a client.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-12 16:41

@parismarx It presents a real conundrum. If you want people to read your stuff, you put it on the open web for consumption, but then Google scrapes it and it just becomes part of their bot, and no one is going to your site to read your stuff. There's a real possibility this could encourage a fragmented Internet, even pushing the "open" web behind authentications to keep bots away. Of course, since a large percentage of people use Google's browser, that probably won't work long term either.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-12 15:47

I'm just going to go curl up in a ball in the corner now.

Me listening to one of our VPs in a meeting today....

Her: And this year we were totally surprised by SOX!

Me (aside to coworker): Why were we surprised by socks?
Him: Socks?
Me: Yea, socks. That's what she just said.
Him: OOOHH!! SOX!!
Me: ... OOOOOHHHH.... 😳

Yep, I'm the idiot who thought for a moment that our executive was talking about socks during a departmental meeting.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-05 20:55

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-04 21:19

@adamsdesk I think (and this is just my guess) it's at least partially because when we're planning or building these environments, we need to compensate for such a wide range of variables we're always hypothesizing about what could POTENTIALLY go wrong. After hearing that sort of thing for so long, people have a hard time differentiating between potential problems and "this IS going to happen if we don't get this problem resolved RIGHT NOW."

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-04 14:19

@adamsdesk Heh, yea. It's a frustrating thing that's happened on more than one occasion, and for some reason horror stories of down servers and data centers in smoking ruins never seem to improve their timelines.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-03 20:59

@indie1337@vivaldi.net If you do, you won't have to wait to get #Vivaldi on your phone!

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-03 20:48

@indie1337@vivaldi.net I really like it actually. The camera bump on the back (can you call that a bump?) is kinda annoying, but a good case pretty much makes it unnoticeable. The phone itself is great, and because it's a Pixel updates are really fast. There's no brand specific stuff you see with other hardware manufacturers. The default launcher is more than usable, but replaceable if you're looking to go in a more iOS flavored direction.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-03 20:43

@indie1337@vivaldi.net How could you possibly confuse me for some other dude? 🤯

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-03 20:42

@ubdvtlab A CW is a Content Warning. They should be used if what you're posting is content that may be controversial or upsetting for people to view. Things like bugs or injuries are common to CW, as well as images that may trigger Trypophobia. For people with social anxiety pictures with overt eye contact. Also, anything political/religious not somehow technology related should also use a CW on Fosstodon.

@cymplecy

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-03 20:31

@indie1337@vivaldi.net You can, you just need to switch your kids to a different app. I use Signal, and my kids all have signal, and it's installed on my desktop so I can easily switch between platforms. There's iOS/iPad and Android versions and versions for your standard Mac/Windows/Linux desktops.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-05-02 22:38

@thestrangelet It is. We don't have any form of CAPTCHA on Fosstodon. If you're required to do one to access the site, it's probably Cloudflare flagging your traffic as suspicious. We're not fans of Cloudflare, and we're working to migrate off of it, but it's mitigating DDOSs for us at the moment so we can only complain so much.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-26 16:59

@bloodaxe Any instances that are added to the blocklist now are given reasons why. Some don't have a reason listed because it wasn't always an option to add one. We haven't gone back to older blocks and added one. I agree it should be something we have, and when we have available bandwidth to add the reasons we will.

As to the evidence DB, we want to operate transparently but at the same time don't want a database full of child porn and/or overt racism.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-18 22:42

@saluki Vivaldi is exactly the browser I want it to be. It's just dripping with features, and almost everything is configurable. I can move buttons and menus and panels. I can make my UI as simple or as complex as I want. There's not just one way to do something that some random person I've never met has selected for me. Add to that Vivaldi incorporates things like RSS readers, Ad/Tracker blockers, and cool features like window tiling, reader mode, etc. There's just so many reason to use it.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-18 18:43

Why yes, #Vivaldi does support themes. Why do you ask?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-18 16:06

#Vivaldi 6 has arrived! There's some really cool features in the newest release including Workspaces and the ability to custom theme pretty much every element of the browser. Don't like the back button because that arrow is just too judgy? Well, now you can change it to something else! Workspaces is like having more than one browser window in the same browser window. Change workspaces and all the tabs at the top of the window change making tab management much simpler!

https://vivaldi.com/blog/vivaldi-on-desktop-6-0/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-17 19:04

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-16 21:15

@ankitpati Yea, the panel in Vivaldi is crazy in how much functionality they build in. The Window panel is just one. There's integrated local translations that operate out of the panel, a markdown based Notes, History Downloads and Bookmarks of course. There's access to Calendars and Tasks. Mail and RSS feeds. You can even add web panels, which load a webpage in the panel. If you keep the panel relatively narrow it defaults to PWA. Expand it and you get the whole thing. So much stuff there.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-16 18:15

@ankitpati Many. The panel lists tabs according to a tree structure. At the top is individual windows the tabs are in, so you can see not just the tab you're looking for but the surrounding tabs. From the window, it lists tabs and tab stacks, and allows for drag and drop reordering of the tabs in that panel. You can move tabs from one window to another, move to a different location in the same window, or create a new stack with existing tabs. You also can rename those stacks.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-16 04:24

@ankitpati That's not really a side panel, it's just a drop down list. It does (kinda) what I originally said, but otherwise is extremely limited. It's like comparing gedit with VSCodium for a IDE.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-15 06:28

@ankitpati Hm, I never seen Chrome with a side panel of all the open tabs that's searchable. Is that something I've missed?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-15 06:24

Hey @PINE64, I've been pretty excited for the new PineTab2 you just announced. One thing I noticed is that the original PineTab has a built in microphone, but the 2 only seems to have a 3.5mm jack with support for a microphone. Did I read that wrong?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-15 06:14

@jimmyhoke I can understand that. If I had to pick a thing about #Vivaldi that I didn't like it's the fact that they're Chromium based. Still, there's benefits to that too. Vivaldi acts as a buffer between me and the more stupid ideas Google comes up with. For example, when Google proposed FLoC, Vivaldi blocked that. Vivaldi gives you the benefits of the Chromium browser, but intentionally blocks the stuff that's for Google and not for you.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-15 00:26

Anxiously waiting for #Vivaldi 6, but while I'm here, I can't tell you how nice it is when you have 130+ tabs open across 5 windows just to open up the Windows panel, do a quick search at the top for what I'm looking for and have a single click take me to the window, tab, and even DESKTOP of what I'm looking for. Seriously, priceless.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-12 17:51

@JValente I haven't seen an authoritative answer to that one yet, but (as you note) rumors have been circling that Apple is going to be dropping their WebKit requirement. Just rumor of course, but it would explain why Vivaldi is willing to make this move now and they haven't earlier.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-11 22:23

@indie1337@vivaldi.net Nope. There's a macOS version, but not an iOS version (so far). Apple has (historically) been to restrictive when it comes to web technology. They've recently been doing more development on that, but last I heard they're still requiring Webkit for any browser on their platform. That seriously limits the possibilities. Rumor has it they're going to be relaxing that requirement (which would be good), so maybe that's why we're seeing this news from Vivaldi. That's just a guess.

@packy Hey, regarding the recent warning. I didn't see things prior to the warning, so I'm guessing it was due to the fact that the post was purely political. Mike Stone @mike 2023-04-11 17:07

@ryo Yea, there's really two parts to the price. One, other companies like Google and Amazon created products that were priced below what it cost them to produce. What they designed/built cost significantly more than they expected, which was poor planning on their part. That's where @PINE64 could really be a boon. They already know that kinda stuff.

Kayn @HKayn 2023-04-08 12:09

Announcing the first public release of Vivaldi VH for #VivaldiBrowser!

Vivaldi VH is a CSS modification that grants your webpages the entire vertical space of the browser window by moving the rest of the UI into a separate column.

Vivaldi Forum discussion: https://forum.vivaldi.net/topic/85447/vivaldi-vh-full-height-for-your-webpages

Download links and installation instructions: https://github.com/HKayn/vivaldi-vh/releases/latest

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-25 19:24

@RL_Dane Ooof, I don't want to get into a shouting match either, but that's borderline offensive 😉.

Vivaldi is Chromium based, but it's so much more than Chrome. There's built in calendaring, translation, tasks, markdown based notes, rss and mail, etc. I can change the color scheme of my keyboard, mouse, and the room I'm in to match the color of the page I'm on with nothing added.

Saying Vivaldi is "Chrome re-skinned" is like saying a computer is a reskinned abacus.

@indie1337@vivaldi.net @Vivaldi

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-11 05:13

@Colone1Sanders7 Nice! Thanks for doing that. Yea, the voice assistant market has been dominated by players where the assistant serves them. Always trying to sell you something or tracking what you do. We really need a functional, offline assistant that's open source that's built to actually help out the individual, not the company that built it.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-10 18:07

@grueproof Thanks for doing that. Open source in the voice assistant market is an important topic for me.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-10 17:10

The people who have been developing OVOS are attempting to establish a nonprofit organization to continue development of their open source voice assistant. OVOS is derived from Mycroft, but with Mycroft AI's recent difficulties has become more of a fork. Other projects such as Neon use OVOS as a base. If you've got a couple spare pennies to rub together they could really use the help in keeping open source voice assistants around.

https://www.gofundme.com/f/openvoiceos

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-05 05:55

@jawsh Hell, it would be super cool just to have a #NeonAI image that would run on a PineTab. That would make a pretty cool assistant with a stupidly easy to print stand to prop up the tablet and a $99 device. I haven't looked up the specs, but I think it would be at least comparable to the current Mark2 performance wise, as that's just running on a Pi4.

@PINE64 @Hawk1291 @Tay0

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-05 05:50

@jawsh It really could. The only real X factor is the SJ201 (https://mycroft.ai/blog/mycroft-mark-ii-july-2020/), which is a custom board. Mycroft itself described it as a way to bring together a "range of off-the-shelf components onto a single PCB", so I wouldn't expect it's out of the range of @PINE64. They've built far more advanced stuff than that. I expect they could have something ready for production in a month if they wanted to.

@Hawk1291 @Tay0

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-05 05:21

@Tay0 @Hawk1291 Yea, it really does. I'm half tempted to pick up another Mark2 anyway as the current version of Neon is completely stand alone and compatible with the Mycroft skills. They've been maintaining compatibility with the OG Mycroft, but with that out of the picture they're free to progress as they see fit. I don't know of any other smart speakers that have the open philosophy. I really wish @PINE64 would step in and save us, but I don't know that they've seen the need so far.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-05 05:18

@jawsh They've been a little bit cagey about that. They've let go most of their staff and I think all of their developers too. Neon is an official partner of Mycroft, and I think the idea is they're going to be pushing all the software development their direction, so I think hardware/software is all going away. If you're keeping track, that doesn't leave a whole lot left. Having tried Neon out on my Mark2, it's probably not a bad thing. Neon is much more capable than the current Mycroft version.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-05 02:43

Whoops, looks like they're out of #RaspberryPi now, so just the last run of #Mark2 devices.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-05 02:38

Not trying to shill for #Mycroft, but right now they have for sale what could possibly be the last run of #Mark2 devices. They've already started shutting down operations, so I doubt they're going to be making more. They're a little on the pricy side, but you can still install Neon AI (https://neonassist.com/neonaidownloads) and keep these devices fully functional with an #OpenSource virtual assistant. If that's not your bag, they have surplus Pis available, and those are hard to find.

https://mycroft.ai/shop/

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-03-03 03:32

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-17 15:50

@dropbear42 It doesn't have amnesia some days, it just sucks all days. First, the translation on Mastodon has inherent limitations, such as requiring the OP to select the proper language. If a post is in Spanish, but French is selected, things won't work. Mastodon has the same issue with language filters too. Second, our implementation on Fosstodon is hit or miss. We have our own self hosted thing, but sometimes it just refuses connections. I need to rebuild it. Self hosting may not be worth it.

Brian MacDonald @bmac 2023-02-15 20:49

Hey, folks. Big layoffs at DigitalOcean today, and my team and I were hit. In fact, so was my adjacent team, and a good chunk of my department. Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-15 16:27

A new release of the #Mycroft software is now available. If you own a Mark 2 and you haven't moved to #OVOS or #NeonOS, you should probably update sooner rather than later.

* Add STT fallback to communicate directly with a free demo Google STT service.

* Add config switch that allows Mycroft to start up without valid pairing information.

* Add direct call to Weather API as fallback mechanism.

They're removing dependence on their backend, which is good. No idea how much longer it'll be there.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-14 21:26

@JoeRess Just finished the episode. Regarding #Mycroft there's some good news. About the same time Michael Lewis was announcing the bad news, Mark II and Dev Kit owners received an email offering a free USB drive for Neon OS. Neon has OFFICIALLY partnered with Mycroft. NeonOS is based off the Mycroft core code, and the USB is a drop in replacement for the one that came with the Mark II. People who bought the device can get the key for free, or it can be ordered for $20.

https://neon.ai/NeonAIforMycroftMarkII

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-10 18:05

@mastohost It's just a tool the people over at pixelfed created to kinda catalog the Fediverse. I use it for a quick source of instance stats so I have a single source no matter what instance I'm looking at. It's just pulling the publicly available information from the instances of various platforms and puts it in a single place. There's actually 3 Fosstodon instances listed. One is ours of course. One is fosstodon.ru (which is 2 people apparently), and fosstodon-org.social.shrimpcam.pw.
