Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-07 19:50

@LinuxToday Perfect! Thank you!

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-07 18:55

@LinuxToday It's allowed as long as the account is properly designated as a bot account (which I see that it is) and the account isn't unmonitored (you need to be responding if someone replies to you).

I'm not familiar with dlvr.it. Is there a way to space your posts out? I doubt anybody would have complained if there hadn't been 10 posts in a minute. That tends to fill up a timeline pretty fast, and since many people use our local timeline for content discovery, that gets noticed.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-07 18:41

@LinuxToday Hey, just wanted to give you a heads up. I approved the appeal to your warning. The reason for the warning/removal was not the content. We'd prefer more than a title and a link, but the biggest issue was there was 10 posts in ~1 minute. All of your posts show up in our local timeline as a couple word snippet with the page logo.

https://www.linuxtoday.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Linux_logos_MainLogo.png

Also, since your first post, you haven't interacted with the community beyond auto-posting.

https://hub.fosstodon.org/coc/#:~:text=Do%20not%20use%20automated,automatically%20are%20not%20acceptable.

@kev

Mike Stone @mikestone 2023-02-06 15:47

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-05 23:32

@servant Welcome home?

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-05 08:58

@ged I do know there are some lists out there with free to use relays. I'll see if I can find one for you.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-02-05 08:57

@ged Hey, it's no bother at all. Unfortunately relays are something I'm not super familiar with. They're not a part of the Mastodon server, and have to be setup separately. We've never done that. We don't use one, but it's my understanding that if you're following someone on Fosstodon and someone on Fosstodon is following you, you'll get our stuff at least. I've heard that relays can be helpful for smaller instances, and I haven't heard anything bad about using them. Sorry, not much help.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-27 21:50

@adamsdesk It works as long as you leave it vanilla. Person1: Hey Mike, Thing1 is broken, can you fix it?
Me: Sure. <work> <work> <work> It's fixed.
Person1: Thanks!
Person2: Hey Mike, Thing1 was broken but someone fixed it. We need to do Thing2, Thing3, and Thing4 because Thing1 is working again.

<sigh>

Should have waited until Monday to fix Thing1.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-18 03:14

@samvarma Since it's exclusive to the Apple ecosystem, I've never used it. When I Twittered, I used #Tweetdeck. Was using it before Twitter bought it, and if I sign into Twitter for any reason today (which I won't say never happens, but is pretty darn rare) I still use Tweetdeck. I guess that's the reason I've been a fan of the Advanced Web UI on #Mastodon. It's not a one to one, but it's close enough that I feel perfectly at home. @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 20:50

@daniel Yep. Sorry, should have been more specific.

@Vivaldi

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 19:56

@samvarma Another thing that might help out is creating lists. I don't think the lists are subject to the same limitation, and if they are you're going to reduce the number of accounts you're looking at from all 170 to however many you put into the list. By creating specialized lists you don't have to depend on the limitations of the Home timeline.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 19:54

@samvarma I've run into the rate limit notification as well. That's a whole different thing. For me, I ran into it because I'd installed a few different clients on my phone, and they were all hitting the server and you're only allowed a fixed number of connections per minute. I exceeded my limit because each client was fetching posts separately and using up my connections too fast. I uninstalled the ones I wasn't using and it went away. I had 5+ installed at the time, unused.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 19:47

@ducker I'm talking about people overusing hashtags and in doing so watering down search results for people that use those hashtags and creating posts that appear spammy. If you're using hashtags where they're SIGNIFICANT, fine. Using them where they're not actually useful is more of a hindrance than a help.

@tim

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 19:28

@samvarma This was actually the first I'd heard of that limitation. I've never run into it before. I don't follow a ton of people, and I leave my browser window open pretty much all the time, so it's never been a thing. I'd guess the best way to avoid this would be to break out the people you're following into different columns in the Advanced UI. That will reduce the numbers per column and avoid that limitation. If you're really worried about missing, don't forget the RSS feeds.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 15:24

@oblomov The number is what I recommend if you're wanting to stay off the radar of the moderation team. It's not a hard-and-fast rule. No one is going to send up red flags if you use 6 hashtags in a single post one time. People are going to notice if you do it every time.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 15:02

@oblomov Quality over quantity is a great metric, but speaking from a moderator's perspective, if your account is reported for spamming, and I scan your timeline and see every single post is littered with hashtags, I'm probably going to agree. I'd also argue that using hashtags in such a manner isn't "quality". I know a lot of people here on Mastodon, and I can't think of a single one who's going to need 4 or more hashtags in their post every single time they say something.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 14:56

@monorailtimes The point is to use them when it's appropriate to the situation. If every single one of your posts is littered with them, then you're probably not doing that. Overuse waters down their value.
@absolutspacegrl

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 14:53

@dalias Hashtags are great when they're used in an appropriate manner. When they're sprinkled all about like the author is some kind of keyboard Johnny Appleseed, then they lose their value.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 14:51

@Vivaldi I love this feature and I use it all the time! The only way it could be better is if there was an Intent that allowed me to automatically add stuff from other applications like my RSS reader straight to the reading list without having to open it first!

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-17 07:36

@JenWojcik Yes, I realize. That's why I want them used when they're appropriate, and not when they're not.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-16 06:04

@doctormo Hey, just wanted to drop a quick explainer regarding your recent appeal.. Let me know if you have questions..

https://hub.fosstodon.org/why-fosstodon-is-english-only/

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-16 05:21

@marathon @marathon@mastodon.online Well, it has nothing to do with cancel culture. Just when Kev and I started this instance, we felt that there was plenty of political discourse on Twitter. There's subjects where people find it difficult to maintain civility, and politics is definitely one. We're fine with politics as long as it at least intersects with technology or FOSS, otherwise we'd prefer it's avoided regardless of what an individuals political stance is. Any general Masto instance allows politics.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-15 23:33

@marathon@mastodon.online @marathon Hey Stephen. I looked into the suspension, and it looks like in the less than 6 weeks you've been with us, you've been reported for various reasons 9 times. It seems like mostly it's because you're putting yourself into situations where people will take offense at what you post. This is one of the reasons we discourage political discourse on Fosstodon (not forbid). I've unsuspended your account. Please try to avoid situations that are going to get you reported more?

@kev @joel @adamsdesk @benjaminhollon @aral @valere @amolith

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-13 14:57

@kev @aral

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-13 14:51

@engineerminded Yes, that's why it's important to use them when they're relevant, but not sprinkle them around in ever single post.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-13 14:49

@MrBerard@pilote.me Hashtags are a great feature, and they certainly making searching for relevant content easier assuming they're not overused. Using them in situations where they're relevant is fine, but overusing them discourages their legitimate use by watering down the results and making posts look like they're selling something.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 18:06

@rubenwardy Hashtags lose their value if they're overloaded with irrelevant content. If the content is relevant for people interested in a particular hashtag, by all means use one. It's fine on occasion to use several if the content warrants it. If every single post is 5+ hashtags you're probably just diluting people's relevant content and making it harder for people using those hashtags.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 17:28

@linux_mclinuxface Looking at your profile I think you're doing it exactly right at this point. No one is going to notice if you use 5 hashtags in a post on occasion. It's when every post you make is overloaded with them that it gets noticed.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 17:22

@samvarma It's fine if it happens on occasion. Making your posts easier to find for interested parties is a good thing. If every single thing you post has ten hashtags, that's probably not being helpful. Hashtags should be used sparingly in situations where they're applicable.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 17:17

@MarkusEicher If you make a post every now and again that has more than 3 hashtags, no one is going to complain. It's when it's every single post that's overloaded with hashtag after hashtag after hashtag that it starts to get noticed.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 17:15

@shawnhooper I agree. Hashtags do have more value, but that value is diminished if they're overused in places where they're not particularly relevant.

If you make one post that has 5 hashtags, that's not going to get noticed by our moderation staff, but if everything you post overloads with hashtags? Yea, that shows up on people's radar.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 16:59

I realize that years of Twitter has encouraged sprinkling #hashtags everywhere in posts, but on Mastodon it makes your posts look spammy. Invariably even if you made the posts manually they're going to get reported by someone. If the moderators can't tell the difference between manual posts and a bot tagging every word in a post with a hashtag, it's more than likely going to get a warning even if it's undeserved. Just FYI. More than three hashtags is going to be too many for a single post.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 15:25

@zlatiah@mastodon.zlatiah-no.one Thanks for bringing it to my attention. I'm looking into it. Sorry for the delayed response.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-12 15:24

@feynman I'm not opposed to it in theory. We've never had anything setup as far as relay stuff is concerned since it's a whole other piece of software from the Mastodon server. I don't really want to maintain anything else at this point. If we just need to add a relay for it to work, I can do that.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-11 03:08

@firestarter451 Incidentally, that language setting also plays a part in the filters. You can specify in your profile that you only want to see posts in a particular language or set of languages, but if the original poster doesn't specify the language correctly (like they post in Spanish but the language setting is English) then languages the individual doesn't want to see will get through the filters.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-11 03:07

@firestarter451 It's on the table, but there's some barriers at this point. The biggest of those barriers that the language in use needs to be manually specified for each post. You've got a default config in your profile, but if you use anything else you need to manually choose it. There's no automatic detection. If you don't change that setting, translations won't be an option. That's more complicated in that some of the major Mastodon clients don't give an option to do that.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-11 02:09

@strycore We're back. Sorry about that.

Mike Stone @mike 2023-01-02 19:32

@frfritz It's definitely on the table. The current implementation is pretty sketchy. It seems to fail quite a bit. We're self hosting the current software. I have some ideas on how to improve the stability, but there's still some questions about the general Mastodon implementation. First, languages need to be properly selected when making the post otherwise translation doesn't work. Languages aren't automatically recognized. If we go with a hosted translation option, cost comes in too.

@dogriley Well, it varies throughout the day for obvious reasons, but right now our application server is running about 26% and our DB server a nice even 30%.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-30 07:49

@Nujtag The answer is both no, and no. The only thing you can really do is delete them from your account on your local instance. The instance you're on notifies other instances of the action and they mirror it on their hosts. This can result in some content being available outside of the instance even after it's been deleted. Fortunately, content does get removed eventually if you've deleted it. It just might take longer than expected.

@fosstodon @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-30 00:57

@hammerron @blainsmith Well, there's not a right way or wrong way. We don't expect every post to be tech. We all have lives and interests outside that venue. Posting about that is both allowed and encouraged. We only ask that you use a CW for certain topics, like politics, religion, etc. If you WANT to create multiple accounts, some do that too. It's up to you which works best. If you want to, that's fine. If you don't want to, that's also fine..

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-27 00:59

@JoeRess Yea, sorry, I'm with @felimwhiteley that @degville is wrong about the WSL/Linux Distro thing. WSL is NOT a Linux distro. WSL is literally a paired down version of Hyper-V. A hypervisor is not the OS that it's running. If WSL were a distro, there wouldn't be Ubuntu for WSL, and Manjaro for WSL. It would just be WSL.

As far as I can tell, this tool isn't a violation of either of those two things. There's an argument to be made regarding privacy, and I've already entered a feature request regarding it.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 07:48

If you're new to Mastodon and looking for people to follow, I just tried out this tool that might help you out.

https://followgraph.vercel.app

It works by checking to see who the people you already follow... uh.... follow. It's not 100% of course, but it does help to surface some interesting people. It doesn't require anything from you other than a profile name. You can even use someone else's, so if you want to see who it thinks I should follow, knock yourself out.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 06:57

@ProfessorCode I'm glad you're not seeing it. It seems to run in streaks and I haven't been able to nail down a cause yet. If it's not going to be reliable and useful, we may just ditch the whole thing.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 06:40

@ProfessorCode It comes up as a link under posts that aren't in the language you've got your UI set to. You're probably not going to be seeing it much on Fosstodon since we're English Only, but you should see it pretty easily if you check out the Federated Timeline. Just click on the "Translate" link, and it SHOULD give you a translation of the post. Or a 503 error, which ahs been happening annoyingly often.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 06:37

@mahmoudajawad The 503 is the error that we've been running into a lot. Not sure why it's coming up. Sometimes the software just goes into some kind of loop. It's been better since I did an update of the language models, but it's still not great. Not sure what's going on there.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 06:35

@mahmoudajawad If you didn't get a 503 error, it could be because of the way Mastodon does translation is pretty elementary. There's a language setting on each of your posts, and you're SUPPOSED to match the setting to the language you're using, but there's nothing to enforce that. Because of that, you can post in Arabic and leave the setting as English, and the Translate option won't come up if your UI language is English. I've seen this often digging through posts from other instances.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 06:31

@mahmoudajawad It's one of the installed languages, yes. I ran a test translation, and it came back with this:

"\u0647\u0630\u0627 \u0627\u062e\u062a\u0628\u0627\u0631 \u0644\u063a\u0629 \u062c\u062f\u064a\u062f\u0629"

That's not an error message, so I'm guessing that would have worked if I used an app that could recognize the symbols. I was just testing at my command prompt.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 06:22

@technoshaman001 Yea, the translate link built right into the post is a little bit more handy, but works significantly less often and doesn't have nearly the language options. Still trying to figure out if this is even worth bothering with.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 05:28

@adamsdesk Yea, that's really a huge selling point for me. Linux? vi is there. BSD of some kind? vi is there. Ancient Unix server from the 70s? vi is there. vi is the editor you can depend on in almost any situation.

@sudoedit

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 05:25

language model for. Unfortunately there doesn't seem to be a way to differentiate between the two. Because I was seeing so many, I took the service down and updated all the language models. We have every option available installed. Everything we can install is installed, so if you're running into a language that isn't installed and you want it installed, we have to work with the authors of LibreTranslate for that one. It's seemed better after the update, but it's only been a few minutes. 2/2

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 05:23

For those that have seen our recent announcement regarding the translation feature, I was noticing in my testing that there were a lot of 503 errors coming back. This can happen for two reasons. One, the service is just overloaded and the Mastodon server didn't get a response in time. We've been seeing the translation software going into loops and pegging the system on occasion. Normal use doesn't overload things. The other reason is you're trying to translate something we don't have a 1/?

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 05:05

@sudoedit I started using vi(m) for work related reasons, and was more often than not in a service account that others on my team had access to as well. We didn't personalize things much because of that. I still use it at work for service accounts and the like. I've just gotten so used to using it pretty much vanilla that I've never really gotten into plugins. It's still my primary editor though.

@adamsdesk

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-24 00:01

@adamsdesk I'd love to make suggestions, but I've never made any kind of effort to add markdown to vim. In every distro I've used it in, it's just there by default. I'm a pretty vanilla vim user. About the only thing I "add" to the mix is I add alias vi="vim" to my .bash_aliases file I'm off to the races.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-23 23:57

@JoeRess I've been wanting to build smart speakers with SBCs because of their form factor. The problem I've run into (other than availability) is just getting audio peripherals that work without standing on top of any device. There's a lot of support from #Mycroft for Pi based devices since the #MarkI and #MarkII are both Pi based devices. A mini PC would work fine for this as well, but I don't want USB devices hanging off it everywhere. The "appliance" device is more what I'm looking for.

Aral Balkan @aral 2022-12-19 08:26

“A town square, by definition, can’t be a business. It needs to be a space owned by the people. That’s what an Elon Musk Twitter can never be, and what Mastodon already is.”

Romilly Cocking (RAREblog) @romilly 2022-12-19 07:33

If you know #python and you'd like to let #birdsite people know your #mastodon handle without triggering a ban, feel free to adopt and adapt this Python code:

print(''.join('f@tnsiory.dglm'[index] for index in [1, 7, 6, 13, 5, 12, 12, 8, 1, 0, 6, 4, 4, 2, 6, 10, 6, 3, 9, 6, 7, 11]))

and post it on the birdsite :)

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-18 23:07

If you're having friends follow you to Fosstodon from other social media sites, first of all thank you for the recommendation. Second, PLEASE make sure they mention something about FOSS or technology in the "Why do you want to join?" section. If they put something like "I want to follow friends" or "Elon sucks", they're probably not going to be accepted. You can follow friends from anywhere in the fed, and whether Elon sucks or not isn't going to change based on which instance you're on.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-15 17:47

@AAMfP Yea, that's fine using the Unlisted. You could probably leave it public as long as it's a reply to an existing post since those don't show up in the Local timeline. That's really our only concern when it comes to the English stuff.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-15 16:54

@me Exactly my thoughts. It would be NICE if there was a heads up when we get a report that had the information, like "This account has been blocked by ${insertValueHere} people on Fosstodon." It doesn't even have to be specific, but that might make it easier to make decisions that are less black and white. Like if it's a questionable thing, but the account has been around for 4 years and never been blocked vs. it's been here two weeks and has been blocked by 73 people, our response may differ.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-15 16:28

@servant Yea, something like that. Also demands that our CoC be more comprehensive and spell out everything that's allowed or not allowed in black and white. As if we could ever anticipate every single scenario that will ever come up ever. Basically my response was "That's not really realistic." We literally have a snippet in our CoC that's called "Catch all" where we say we can't anticipate everything and we'll act on things we deem inappropriate even if they're not documented in the CoC.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-15 16:20

@Serion Nope, though that would be an interesting metric to have. I really wouldn't want to get notified though.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-15 16:18

@servant Actually no. That went pretty painlessly as far as at least we were concerned. We had one of our Patreons lose his mind over a warning, and another one this morning seemed to be freaking out over one with a "Please don't send me back to Twitter" appeal for a warning over something relatively minor. We get that kind of response more often than I'd expect over just minor things. You'd think we were the mafia coming after their family or something.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-15 16:05

Just a reminder, if you or someone you know has received a warning from the Fosstodon moderation team for whatever reason, this is usually just a heads up that something you're doing may need some tweaking. It's not a "Look at me sideways again and I'll drop an asteroid on your head" kind of thing. We're not going to ban you if you accidentally post in Spanish because you forgot to update your privacy settings, or missed a CW. This isn't Twitter, and we don't hand out bans for nothing.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-08 17:05

@codesections From a hardware perspective, sure. From a software perspective, they're using entirely different operating systems. A tablet with an external keyboard has more in common with a smart phone than a laptop from a software perspective.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-08 15:05

@codesections Sometimes? In these cases "desktop" just means "Not Mobile". They're not talking about the hardware, but how the page gets rendered, and from the software perspective there's no relevant difference between a desktop computer and a laptop computer.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-08 03:50

@lps I love that part best actually. The distributed nature of Mastodon is really it's greatest strength. I'd love to see more companies and groups do what @Vivaldi has done and create their own instances. We obviously don't mind hosting open source projects here on Fosstodon, but I'd really like to see new instances like mozilla.social, and ubuntu.social. Even smaller groups like local LUGs. Really spread the word.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-05 15:00

@hari_seldon Regarding your recent appeal to the English only warning, it's fine to write in Italian if you change the permission level of your post to something other than Public. Public posts show up in the local timeline (not just friends). Any other permissions level does not. Also, you're free to reply in any language you'd like. Please do keep in mind that Mastodon does treat replies to yourself as a Thread and not an actual reply so they show up in the local timelines as a new post.

Dave Winer ☕️ @davew 2022-12-03 00:42

Mastodon which is incredibly hot, supports RSS beautifully.

Just add .rss to any account to get the feed. Amazing!

https://mastodon.social/@davew.rss

Open that in your favorite feed reader. It’ll work.

Post a screenshot, say what the reader app is.

And pass this on to everyone who uses a feed reader.

Spread the word!

This is a huge deal for the open web.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-12-01 23:20

@mattsakkas I think you'll find the learning curve isn't as bad as it seems out of the gate. The hardest part for most people is getting around the idea that there is no algorithm feeding you material, which means at first things can be a little sparse. I highly recommend you taking those hashtags you mentioned in your introduction and following them instead of just looking for individuals. That'll populate your Home feed with anybody that mentions your favorite things!

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-30 15:25

@ru It's an implied "passing of the torch" kind of thing. I've heard it traditionally applied to the the English monarchy, so it notes the passing of the old monarch and the arrival of the new with no discernable gap in the role. "The Queen is dead, long live the King!". It's also come to be used to imply a false transition. An IMPLIED change when little real change is happening.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-30 15:08

@technoshaman001 They're done. The shortcodes are the same as the filenames.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-28 20:49

Just a reminder, if you or someone you know is being harassed in any way, please report it. Also, we encourage the use of blocking on an individual level. If a person is from a non-Fosstodon instance, all the moderators of this instance can do is limit their reach so they don't show up in our feeds, or ban them from accessing our community. People not on Fosstodon are subject to the Code of Conduct of their instance, not Fosstodon's, so different things may be acceptable on different instances.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-28 15:40

@RyuKurisu There's nowhere in the settings that I know of for allowed formats. I'll double/triple check maybe @kev or @cooper knows something I don't.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-28 15:10

@MurrayWindripper It's not something we can do on a #Fosstodon level, but it couldn't hurt if an issue was entered in GitHub. The trick is that it's not as simple as maintaining the same privacy level. For example, if I send out a message to "Followers Only", and you reply and the setting is retained, who gets it? Should it be only my followers? Should it be only your followers? I'd argue the first makes the most sense, but then the permitted recipients need to follow the thread all the way?

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-28 15:05

Took Thursday and Friday off work last week for the holiday here in the United States, and came back to over 1000 prefilter unread messages in my work Inbox. After the filters cleaned things out and I manually went through and took out automated messages I don't have filters for, not a single email to me from a person. There's something broken about this system.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-23 15:05

@mykl Hey! The hardware hosting we use is done through masto.host, who in turn uses OVH. @kev and I don't hands on that part of the hosting, but we just upgraded and we're currently running at < 30% capacity of our environment. The costs we're accruing are listed on our Hub site:

https://hub.fosstodon.org/about/

They're a little bit behind right now on that page (they're about 2x what is listed) because we've been moving so fast. We'll get it back up to date when we have more current numbers to post.

Ateriath @Ateriath 2022-11-23 00:21

Theoretical physics textbooks should replace the Schrodinger‘s Cat Problem with the USB-A Uncertainty Principle:

A USB-A connector is always in the incorrect orientation, until the port is directly observed.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-23 00:32

@kednar @fosstodon Send your request with some references for what you want to @cooper. We can get you fixed up.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 23:50

@1patrickstephen I just noticed that you're using the official Mastodon app on your phone or tablet. For reasons that I don't fully understand, the author of that app has decided to hide the local timelines under the search/Community. Personally speaking, on my phone I use the PWA. It's not as nice in the 4.0.x version of Mastodon, but it's still pretty good. The PWA brings the local timeline more front and center. That should help in discovery quite a lot.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 23:47

@1patrickstephen In my experience, people on Mastodon are more interested in content and engagement. Our local timeline is pretty tuned to people who are interested in technology, and anybody who's on our instance can see public posts you make in that timeline, whether they follow you or not. This will allow others to see what you post and for you to see what they're posting. Engage with content that you find interesting, and you'll find people pretty quick.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 22:29

@jlcenter Not that I'm aware of. If you want to unfollow, you need to search for the hashtag, click on the specific one, and in the upper right hand corner there's an "Unfollow" option. It really should be an option in your Preferences -> Follows and followers. Not there as far as I can see, at least in the current release.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 21:28

@underlap I try to do that when I can, but the task that inspired my original post, unfortunately not.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 21:25

@helgztech I've been a supporter of Mycroft for a while now. I was part of the Kickstarter for their original Mark I speaker, and I came back for the Mark II. There's currently an effort underway to get the Mycroft software to work fully offline, which is one of the the things on my birthday list. I have some smart lights and stuff in my house, and it annoys the heck out of me that I can't turn the stupid light off if my Internet is down. Mycroft is looking to solve that, and none too soon.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 20:51

@mobian Heh, kinda. We have a couple early model Roombas (the kind that doesn't map your house and send a copy of your floorplan to Amazon) that I have on a schedule. I go through with the shopvac for baseboards and the upright for the rest of the house every couple weeks. The Roombas keep things livable in the between times. TMI I know.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 20:49

@technoshaman001 If you can, that would be great! They just can't be bigger than 256k. Anything that's a uniform height/width in PNG format that's less than 256k..

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 20:37

@alexan Since 2017 on Fosstodon. I was briefly on another instance but I can't remember if that was late 2016 or if that was still part of 2017. It's been a while.

I really like Mastodon. It's really the only social media I use. I still have a Twitter account, but I've used it 3, maybe 4 times in the last couple years. The biggest hurdle with Mastodon is getting started. Once you're over that initial bump, it's the best social media experience I've had.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-22 20:35

Sometimes I'll inline something because I don't want to bother using the man page of another tool to figure out what I want to do. Anything I keep around for a few minutes I'll just #!/usr/bin/bash and add the +x. Saves me keystrokes. I've never done a kernel upgrade via script though....

Mike Stone boosted
AJ Sadauskas @ajsadauskas 2022-11-13 05:15

The thing about Twitter is that it really lacks a lot of the features you'd expect from a true Mastodon replacement.

For example, there's no way to edit your toots (which they, confusingly call "tweets"—let's face it, it's a bit of a silly name that's difficult to take seriously).

"Tweets" can't be covered by a content warning. There's no way to let the poster know you like their tweet without also sharing it, and no bookmark feature.

There's no way to set up your own instance, and you're basically stuck on a single instance of Twitter. That means there's no community moderators you can reach out to to quickly resolve issues. Also, you can't de-federate instances with a lot of problematic content.

It also doesn't Integrate with other fediverse platforms, and I couldn't find the option to turn the ads off.

Really, Twitter has made a good start, but it will need to add a lot of additional features before it gets to the point where it becomes a true Mastodon replacement for most users.

#twitter #mastodon #twittermigration @fediverse

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-21 16:57

@ljunge Yep. We're a smaller community on Mastodon, but more active. In my experience, you're going to get a lot more interactivity here than there.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-21 16:11

Just in case any of our newer members are using "older" computers, there's a Mastodon client just for you. 😏 :windows95:

https://github.com/meyskens/mastodon-for-workgroups

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-20 22:19

@rudolf @danjones000 It's true that, theoretically, the admins (or really anybody who have access to the DB) could read your DMs (that's why they're called DMs and not Private Messages), the same is true with Twitter. Also, I have a vague recollection of a plan to implement E2EE for DMs (making them PMs) at some point. Also, since Mastodon is open source, anybody that wants to add E2EE can contribute code. Not sure what the buy in on this is, but sounds promising.

https://github.com/soatok/mastodon-e2ee-specification

@kev

@cdenesha This is fine. We'll give it a look, but we're not US based. Our servers are located in France.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-19 21:28

@bertspace There is not unfortunately. In fact, usernames are a one and done as far as Mastodon is concerned. This isn't a Fosstodon policy specifically, it's every Mastodon instance. Usernames can't be changed, and if they're ever deleted for any reason they're unrecoverable (though there's rumor that last but might be changing, just don't hold me to it). If you want to "change" your name, you have to create a new account with the new name and migrate over. Cludgy I know. Sorry.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-19 21:25

@jonasvautherin They're listed automatically on https://fosstodon.org/about in the Moderated servers section.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-19 20:59

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-19 20:39

@BobCollins I've been enjoying it. I use it on my primary system. My cousin recommended it to me. It's a pretty decent combination of ease and customizability. My biggest complaint is they're slower than I'd like with updates. The UI is still based on Gnome 3.38 and there's not due a major release until next year, so it's not likely to change for a while. I normally wouldn't care, but the jump between 3.38 and 4.0 was a big one, and there's a lot of incompatibilities there.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-19 01:50

Current process to deploy DB code (not Fosstodon):

Login Computer: Username, Password.
Login to VPN: Username, password, YubiKey code + touch
Open Jira: Username, password, YubiKey code + touch
Login Linux Server: Username, password.
Execute deploy.

I feel like there's SOMETHING in this process that could be streamlined, but I just can't seem to put my finger on it.

Mike Stone boosted
Chief TWiT :twit: @leo 2022-11-18 17:54

Now that we're learning this lesson that centralized silos are brittle and operate in the interest of the owners not the users...

...please note the move toward centralizing podcasts into apps from Amazon/Audible, Spotify, iHeart, YouTube, TikTok etc.

If you like podcasts, use an RSS-based podcast player. Support the open ecosystem. We can only survive if you clearly see the threat and act supportively.

7 million accounts donate $2 to the upkeep of their local #Mastodon instance per month = $14mil and about $10mil more than Musk wanted to (and won't) make for a silly check mark.

Dave Troy :toad: @davetroy 2022-11-16 19:09

A few recommendations for life on Mastodon:

1) Follow anyone you think looks potentially interesting; you can always unfollow later, and they may lead you to new people via boosted posts.

2) Boost posts you think are worthy, so others can discover new content.

3) Don't obsess on replicating your Twitter follows on Mastodon; let it be its own experience, and grow it organically. Obvs follow anyone you miss from Twitter, but this isn't a 1:1 replacement; have fun, follow your instincts.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-16 23:19

The email address on the site is an oversight on our part. That used to be our address and we had to change it due to spam related issues. We seem to have neglected to update the page. We'll fix that. I apologize.

Posting limits aren't a horrible idea, but currently it's not part of the Mastodon software.

Ru (Tech) :blobcatsadlife: @ru 2022-11-16 14:36

Fosstodon folks — quick reminder that non-English posts are only an issue if they are public posts (i.e. they appear on the local timeline).

If these are replies, unlisted, private, it's fine.

Please look at the exceptions section here: https://hub.fosstodon.org/why-fosstodon-is-english-only/

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-15 08:13

@servant It's pretty slick.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-15 04:13

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-15 03:15

@Cleoqc And it's moderately retroactive. The code for editing has been in place for a while now, but the feature wasn't enabled. Most recent posts can be edited now, not just the ones since the upgrade.

@mttaggart @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-15 02:38

@serebit Yes?

@Mastodon @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-14 21:18

@alexanderm No, you didn't miss it. I added it because it was highly requested. ;)

@fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-14 15:26

@alexanderm :tutanota:

@fosstodon

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-14 03:04

@jburd Political posts are allowed, but if you're going to post them, we ask that you use a Content Warning (CW) to give people the opportunity to avoid them if they so choose. This is the same policy we have for anything that may be deemed "inflammatory". There are subjects that may be inflammatory even if they shouldn't be. We trust that the community knows what those subjects are. If the content of a CWed post violates other portions of the CoC, further actions may still be taken.

@kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-14 00:56

@RL_Dane Ooo, that's probably a bad idea. If you were going to try something like that, I'd look at image descriptions. They allow for an additional 1500 characters above and beyond the 500 allowed in a post itself. Combine the two and you get 2000 total characters to work with. A series of DM type posts to yourself could in theory be used as a method of storage. It would still take a lot of posts to store anything meaningful though. Images/Steganography is a better choice.

@servant @joel @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-13 23:10

@RGrunblatt I refreshed @vepain@sciences.re, so should be good to go?

@vepain @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-13 23:08

@Mehrad @Psyklax Yea, either @kev or I should update that post. It's from 2019 and some of the information on it is dated. Fosstodon wasn't even two years old at the time, so all of that stuff was new to us. We'll get it updated.

🦥 Mx.Grey ☭ :verified_gay: @TheAtheistAlien 2022-11-12 16:46

mastodon vs twitter (updated)

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-13 03:58

@wroy Hi, welcome!

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-13 03:57

@okapi People on other instances still see the emoji. It loads from our server. They just can't use it. They can see it, but not use it themselves. Unless their admin adds it for them.

Dick Morrell @cloudguy 2022-11-08 08:08

@anasimion I think what happened was that it has been the sensible folk who come from either legacy environment / code / community has seen the writing on the wall.

They (we) dip our toe and think "Oh this has shades of IRC but oooooh shiny" and we start to put our tents up and light up our individual gas stoves to heat our beans.

Slowly but surely we come out the tent flap and realise that there are other tents but also communal camp fires with people sitting round them.

That's this

Mike Stone boosted
phildini @phildini 2022-11-08 07:49

Hey, if you want to be "verified" on the fediverse as being _actually you_, you don't need some third party to verify you or to check some list.

Got a domain you own, that's obvs you?

Paste `<a rel="me" href="https://your.server/@your_username">Mastodon</a>`into the html on that domain, add that domain to your profile links, bam, verified at least as comprehensively as a lot of folks on birdsite.

If this seems hard, I will help you! You can verify yourself, promise!

(boosts for reach a-ok)

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-07 23:49

@Tattooed_mummy @binarytango@mstdn.binarytango.com @JayF @kev Yes, if you report someone from the federated timeline you're given the choice to send the remote instance or not. Instance rules vary, so sometimes that part isn't going to get you anywhere. If you choose to send it to the remote admin, the report shows up as being from your local domain. In my case, it would say something along the lines of "someone as Fosstodon.org blah blah". The local instance has some capability, but not as much as the host instance.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-07 23:45

@smcn @eumiro @brianokken @kev Yep, we don't have a process in place other than just asking us somehow. Here, email, the Mattermost chat. However you can get our attention.

BrianLinuxing 🇮🇪✅ @BrianLinuxing 2022-11-06 20:00

#twittermigration

Imagine, you have to run a successful party for nine children but instead the whole school turns up, all 400 of them.

But you can’t turn them away, you have to feed them well and be cheerful, that would be very hard eh?

- - -

That is what the #mastodon technical administrators are doing now.

They are playing catch up while trying to keep the services live and we should all be patient, it’s incredibly complex to run these systems and keep them up 24/7.

Patience, please.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-06 20:20

@mweiss Answering a post in the language it's posted in is always OK. We're mainly concerned about posts that show up in the public timelines. This is just the initial post. You can make posts you want to make in German Unlisted or Followers Only and that's fine too. The only posts we worry about are new posts that are public. All else you're free to do in whatever language you're comfortable with.

@kev @cooper @grueproof

If you're new to Mastodon you may not be aware that mentioning someone doesn't make it a direct message. It's just notifying them and still putting that into the local feed for more than 30K people to read.

Brian Hynds @nittanygeek 2022-11-04 18:32

Any recommendations for vulnerability assessments? We're a mid-sized rural K12 district.
Currently doing:

- PingCastle Health Checks
- Purple Knight Security Assessment Reports
- CIS-CAT Pro Assessor Reports
- Nessus Pro Credentialed Patch Audits

We don't have a dedicated CISO, so we do our best with scored assessments that we can create action items from and continue hardening things as we go. Cybersecurity on a shoestring budget, if you will.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-04 18:04

@mattrose @shawnhooper @kev Thanks to both of you. We do our best, and any help we can get is much appreciated.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-04 15:06

@rwwmike ask that you use that for any topics that are not tech related and may be considered inflammatory. Religion, politics, whatever. If you want to start a war over vi vs. emacs, that doesn't require a CW. If you want to start a war between political parties in random country, CW is required. It doesn't block people from reading what you post, just gives them a warning if they'd rather ignore it.

This went longer than I expected. Sorry for the spam I guess. 5/5

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-04 15:04

@rwwmike permission setting. Followers only is what it sounds like. Only people following your account can see those posts. Mentioned people only is also pretty self explanatory. That's the Mastodon equivalent of a direct message. It's only visible to people you want to see it and doesn't show up in any timelines or searches. Keep in mind that this is NOT E2EE. The last thing that should be mentioned is the CW. That just hides your post behind a short blurb that describes your content. We 4/?

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-04 15:01

@rwwmike own posts, you have a couple different permission levels you can choose. The globe means it's public. That's visible to everyone everywhere if they want to see it. Unlisted is visible to everybody, but it doesn't show up in the public feeds. This is an important distinction if you want to do something like post in a language other than English on Fosstodon. Doing so is perfectly fine, but it can't be in the public feed, so you'd have to use anything other than Public as a for your 3/?

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-04 14:59

@rwwmike publicly. Based off default settings, your posts will show up there, and any of the ~28000 people here on Fosstodon can see it. We're pretty proud of our local feed here because the we have a pretty great community on Fosstodon. Federated is the firehose. That's every post from every person on a server that Fosstodon knows about that's posting publicly. Think Local feed, but EVERYWHERE. That's the Wild Wild West out there. Anything can be posted and often is. When you're making your 2/?

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-04 14:56

@rwwmike Well, on the right you should have a series of choices. Home is the people you follow. You can follow any account on any server that Fosstodon knows about and their posts will show up there. Notifications are pretty self explanatory, but I'd recommend looking at the configuration options there. You have some pretty nice options to tune what you wan to know about. Explore shows you trending stuff. Posts, Hashtags, etc. Local is every post on Fosstodon by anybody that's posting 1/?

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-02 22:28

@AlexVoss That's a fair option as well. I occasionally post pictures here on Fosstodon, but they're usually tech related in some way. All the other pictures I post I do so on @mikestone. Those are more general.
@kunzler @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-02 22:17

@kunzler is done so behind a Content Warning. That's topics like politics or religion. There are other topics that may be considered inflammatory but are OK, like me coming out and saying that vi is better than emacs. That's perfectly OK, and may actually cause a war in the replies. There may be crossover in these areas, and in those cases we trust you to use your best judgement. If you have a doubt regarding the content, you can always hit up one of the moderation team. 2/2

@AlexVoss @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-02 22:13

@kunzler I'd say that's more an attribute of being more generally focused rather than having a specific community like ours. To answer the question, we are a community of FANS of open source, but we don't expect it to be 100% of your life. Post the picture, just be sure to add a description for those who are visually impaired. Just nothing R rated or above. We're family friendly. Also, generally posting, we just ask that anything non-tech related that may be inflammatory 1/2

@AlexVoss @kev

Mike Stone boosted
Now at cwebber@social.coop ! @cwebber 2022-11-01 20:05

So here's the biggest tip I can give you if you're using Mastodon's web interface...

Someone sent you a link to a post on an external site and you really wanna fave and boost it but you don't know how?

You can copy and paste the URL the search box and it'll show it in your local UI!

Most important undocumented feature of Mastodon's web UI IMO. You're welcome.

Mike Stone boosted
Ben Ramsey @ramsey 2022-11-02 12:34

Folks, keep this in mind: if you delete your account on a Mastodon server, admins have no way of restoring your account. The username is gone, and no one can use it.

If you’re moving to another server, it’s best to set your account as an alias/forwarding so you can recover it later, if desired.

That said, if you’ve forgotten your password, I can help out with that. 🙂

#noxp

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-02 21:36

@shawnhooper Good to meet you too! Welcome!

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-02 21:31

@robcee It really is a slick service. Usually it federates but they got a little overwhelmed with the whole #TwitterMigration so they have federation off right now. As soon as they've got that issue resolved, you can follow PixelFed accounts from Mastodon or Mastodon accounts from PixelFed. It's like commenting on Insta posts from Twitter.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 22:13

@therealchris If the politician with the new social network is the one I think, then no. That new social network doesn't federate even though the code is a fork. Federating is the choice of the admin, so even non-forked Mastodon instances don't NEED to federate if they don't want to. In the case of that new social network, they didn't want to. That's assuming they didn't make changes to the code significant enough to break federation in the first place. I have no idea.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 22:02

@linux_mclinuxface Welcome! I understand that first impression where things aren't quite like you're used to. Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 22:00

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 22:00

@wraldpyk If you haven't at least looked at it, you should try out the Advanced Web Interface in your Appearance preferences. If you're familiar with Tweetdeck, it's a similar layout. It allows you to add columns for lists, for your various timelines, and even hashtags or groups of hashtags.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 15:43

@privacat It doesn't (probably). BlueSky is, at least hypothetically, powered by the AT protocol which is (according to the BlueSky blog) "a new federated social network". The AT protocol is more a competitor to ActivityPub than Twitter or Mastodon.

https://blueskyweb.org/blog/10-18-2022-the-at-protocol

I was just noting that even though BlueSky is "federated", and even if Mastodon or other current Fediverse platforms adopted AT, BlueSky probably would not be considered part of the Fediverse.

@technicalissues @kev @matrix

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 15:00

@privacat If Mastodon/Eugen decided to throw in AT into the mix, I'm not sure many would consider Bluesky to be part of the Fediverse.

It's not just being a federated protocol either. Most of the classic internet protocols were federated. irc, nntp. Matrix is federated (as noted by @technicalissues), but not part of the Fediverse.

So, after 5+ years as a Mastodon admin and longer spent in the Fed, I'm going to go with a solid "Idunno". 2/2

@kev @matrix

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 14:53

@privacat That's actually a really good question, and one that I'm not sure has a really good answer to go with it. As @technicalissues noted, most of the time these days the Fediverse is connected with ActivityPub, but even that distinction is a little squishy around the edges. The whole thing started with OStatus, not ActivityPub as its base protocol. Diaspora instances are often considered part of the Fed even though they're not compatible with ActivityPub (by default). 1/?

@kev @matrix

Mike Stone @mike 2022-11-01 05:34

@butchland Welcome aboard!

We started a Mastodon instance where I'm in the US, Kev's in the UK, our servers are in France, and our community is global.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-30 07:22

@hywan You've pretty much already done it in your report. I can't say for certain as I'm not directly familiar with this particular instance, but I'm guessing that it's admin is the only non-automated member. There's no individuals mirroring accounts, just a program running that's mirroring Twitter accounts to matching Mastodon accounts. Since the information on that account is public and there's a link back to your Twitter account as the "owner" of the content, I doubt we can do anything else.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-30 04:58

@heidilifeldman It occurred to me after the fact that I need to make sure it's understood that this is just me. We have a team of 6 people, @kev and myself and four moderators. We also use masto.host for hosting, so we're not responsible for anything beyond managing the environment. This is just MY time investment. I don't know how much time the others are putting in.

@binarytango@mstdn.binarytango.com @Gargron @stux

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-30 03:03

@binarytango@mstdn.binarytango.com @heidilifeldman It depends on a lot of factors like how large of an instance you have, how many active users, how strict your Code of Conduct is, and the quality of your community. At #Fosstodon, we require approval to become members, and while that keeps the spam down (and the reports) it does take a pretty decent chunk of time per day. We also keep an eye on hashtags that we allow to trend so we don't get spamtags. I'd estimate I spend an hour or two daily?

@Gargron @stux @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-30 01:08

@mrak Sure, we'll see if we can get some language in the CoC that makes this more clear. The reason is boosts don't show up in the Public timelines like a regular post does. You're just boosting to your own followers, which means other language would be fine in any context.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-29 20:42

@joanisc An actual #MarkII, probably not. The best you can probably get is installing Mycroft on a Linux system. The speaker/microphone on the Mark II should be tuned to not suffer from the surrounding noise issues, so if you test it on the computer and write off any audio issues you may have with speaker/microphone, you can get a good idea of it's capabilities. That's assuming you're willing to assume they didn't make any mistakes with audio tuning.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-29 20:39

@tyr@pettingzoo.co Oh so jealous!! How is it? Mine don't arrive until next month!

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-29 20:39

@mikefordays Well, so far no luck in that particular arena. About the closest thing I've seen is the TalkSocket.

https://talkgo.io/products/talkgo

This is external hardware that's SUPPOSED to eventually work with Mycroft. It doesn't now, it's specific to the Alexa software I think. The hardware uses a phone based client, so IN THEORY it could dictate text messages with Mycroft. That's a lot of "supposed to" and "in theory" for my taste. Not sure any of that is ever going to pan out.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-29 20:34

@Mcdan to work with virtually no work at all. I have a Mycroft running in a WSL config on my kids' gaming machine, and it worked pretty much flawlessly there. On a Picroft the microphone volume was incredibly low even when I maxed it out. I have the Adafruit microphone array, but haven't had a chance to try it yet.

I have Mycroft running on many different computers, tablets, and phones. It always seems to work fine. It's just getting that "Assistant" formfactor that causes issues. 2/2

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-29 20:31

@Mcdan Not especially. I've tried to emulate the small, self contained assistant type device for a while now, and I haven't had much luck. The mic is really the biggest headache in the mix, but I think my biggest problem is I've been trying to do audio in and out with the same hardware. I've tried the Raspiaudio Audio DAC, and that "works" with some caveats. The volume seems to be on max with no way to change it. I also had pretty good luck with a USB conference microphone. I got that 1/?

https://hub.fosstodon.org/why-fosstodon-is-english-only/

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-29 19:56

@hywan I wanted to talk to you about that report you entered. Since the account is on another instance I can't do anything about it other than block it. I know the report was also forwarded over to the moderators on their instance.

That account isn't really stealing your identity. The whole instance is just a big Twitter mirror. It's got your information because it pulled it from your Twitter profile, and (in theory) will just mirror what you post there. I don't know if there's an opt out.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 23:40

@array @Tay0 @wholesomedonut @joel @0xf0 @proactiveservices @edgren @Hawk1291 @RL_Dane @unicornfarts @Anfeald @markusl @Nujtag @golemwire @dallin

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 23:37

@twizzay I think a voice UI to a smart home may still be in the cards, but we're no where near where we need to be for that to work effectively, and Google and Amazon are just pushing it from the advertising angle, which is never going to get us where we need to be. And let's face it, Google and Amazon are really the only real contenders in that market right now, which is why I'm pushing so hard on an open source option. Functionality for the end user and not a revenue source for corps.

@tulpa

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 22:11

@adamsdesk I haven't done it myself, but the Selene backend is open source, and I know some people that have done it from the Mycroft Mattermost server. A backend of SOME kind is still required, but it doesn't have to be the one at Mycroft.ai. You can self host it.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 22:09

@twizzay Yea, I've been thinking of trying it on one of the the Pine64 boards. I've gotten it to run on a PineTab, PinebookPro, and a PinePhone, so I don't see why it wouldn't work no problem. Some of those are more expensive than $45, but they're a lot cheaper than $500.

@ocdtrekkie

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:52

@adamsdesk THEIR backend isn't required, but A backend is still required. At least right now. There's very little reason for it as far as I can tell. Pretty much everything is running local. The backend is more for configuration and a light web server on device should be more than capable of doing that bit.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:49

@puck Oh, and it's worth noting that the Kickstarter had a significantly different (and more advanced looking) hardware/software configuration.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:46

@tulpa Yea, for $500 you can pick up a Yoga or something, put it in a "tablet" or "media" type configuration, and run Mycroft on that. You'd get a faster system that's just as capable for less money. I can't think of any reason (other than I have cash to burn) to pay $500.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:45

@puck The original Kickstarter was $129. You could get a 3 pack for $300. Now they're expecting to sell one for $500. That's quite the increase.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:42

@ocdtrekkie It really is. I can pick up a low end laptop that'll run it just as well for significantly less than that $500 mark. Get something like a Yoga where the keyboard folds back behind it and you're golden.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:40

@adamsdesk On the plus side, the whole thing is open source so even if the company goes under we can still have the software. Even the backend is available, so theoretically you can setup your own and not have to use their services at all. That's not as easy as I'd like. I do know they're working to get the whole thing to work offline, which would mean their backend wouldn't be required. I'd love to see that sooner rather than later, just in case.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:38

@tulpa Yea, that's a tough pill to swallow. When you can go pick up a Nest speaker or an Echo for a fraction of that with arguably better functionality (if you don't mind selling everything you say and do to Amazon or Google), I don't see that enough people are going to get one. Especially the average person that's not super nerdy about their privacy. Why would they?

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-28 21:29

"We are excited to offer an early adopter price of $349.99 until November 30. This is an opportunity to pick up the definitive pioneer in privacy-driven, open-source voice technology before the price is listed at an MSRP of $499.99."

Ouch. I love Mycroft. I've been using it for years, but at $349.99 I probably wouldn't buy one. $499.99 would be a definite no. I know they need to pay the bills but they're competing with Google and Amazon. The price matters here.

https://mycroft.ai/blog/a-statement-on-the-mark-ii/

If you're new to #Fosstodon and haven't enabled the Advanced Web Interface in your preferences (or you just don't like it), make sure to check out our Local Timeline.

https://fosstodon.org/web/public/local

It's a feature Twitter doesn't have, and shows the public posts of everybody on your Local Instance.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-27 15:24

@nosherwan #Fosstodon currently is running version 3.5.3 of the #Mastodon software (which is the latest). We do have plans to upgrade when a newer version is available. 😉

You're probably referring to visual differences you may see to another instance. There are ways to change the look of Mastodon, but they're limited and doing so can complicate updates. We leave Fosstodon as close to vanilla as possible to ease the update process. Changes to Mastodon defaults will be kept in Fosstodon.

I was walking out my front door to get my mail today when I walked right into political canvassers going door to door in my neighborhood. After finally succeeding in getting rid of them I got my mail and literally all of it was political fliers.

This seems like a good time to remind everyone that while politics aren't forbidden on Fosstodon, if you're going to post about them please do so in moderation and behind a CW. For any questions please consult our CoC or ask one of our moderation team.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-24 16:04

@RL_Dane Well, for the most part I do OK socially despite being pretty introverted. I just look at my home as my sanctuary. It's something I share with my family and not really anybody else. It feels like someone is invading our private space when we have someone else in our house, even if it's just friends of my kids. I feel like I need to almost put on a show, and it's just mentally exhausting. I don't want that in my home. I'm the same way when someone else is using my computer.

@servant

@cameron

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-23 04:14

@Tay0 Yea, the #MarkI is going for the same price as the #MarkII right now. The Mark I is super hard to get and pretty rare since they haven't been made for a long time. You're going to have to wait a couple months (even though they're shipping now) if you want to buy one new, but you'll get the newer hardware. The Mark II is based around a Pi4, so you can literally plug in a monitor/keyboard/mouse to it and swap out the SD and you can have a fairly reasonable desktop computer.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-22 21:04

@allinone0 Oh, and it goes without saying that @kev and I aren't profiting secretly off of Fosstodon.

<<double checks bank balance>>

@GamePlayer @nicd

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-22 21:02

@allinone0 Well, Fosstodon is open source from the hardware to the web. We can't speak to what you're using as a browser, or I'd say it's open source from the hardware to your eyes. Mastodon is open source, and I recently saw a nice guide on how to create your own instance (if you're interested).

https://www.howtoforge.com/how-to-install-mastodon-social-network-on-ubuntu-22-04/

Is the Fediverse in total open source? No way to know. The Fediverse is based on ActivityPub, and anybody open or closed can use that protocol.

@GamePlayer @nicd @kev

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-22 06:04

@RyuKurisu I mixed up my STT and TTS in there in one place.. I'm sure you get the picture though.

@krisgesling

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-22 06:02

@RyuKurisu My main laptop is running Zorin 16.1 Pro, and it's a great distro.

@hund @nacioss

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-22 06:01

@RyuKurisu It's my understanding (and hopefully @krisgesling will correct me on this if I'm wrong) that the original Mark I was designed around a Raspberry Pi 2, and it just didn't have the juice to do the STT, determine answer, and then STT in a reasonable time given the hardware available. The Mark I eventually shipped with the Pi3b I think, and the new Mark II will ship with a Pi 4. The new hardware has the power to do what it needs to do to move those tasks local instead of cloud based.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-21 22:43

After the announcement of the #MarkII shipping yesterday from #Mycroft, one comment from @krisgesling caught my attention. In response to a question regarding the account registration requirement, Gez said "we're also aiming to have this completely optional."

That's an intriguing tidbit as it takes what's really the last remaining network requirement for Mycroft out of the picture. #Selene has been an option for a while, but it's more difficult than an out of the box solution. Looking forward.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-07 21:04

@trevdev Appreciate the offer, but right now themes are embedded into the Mastodon code, so that requires us to specially compile some components of the system to get them in. It's not impossible, but we'd prefer not to deviate from the base code to make things easier to upgrade and keep things more stable over time. I'm hoping in the future that will change and maybe Eugen will change his mind on that particular feature. If he does, you'll be the first to know.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-06 18:03

@servant Yep. Well, it can. The Tasks list is part of your Calendar configuration in Vivaldi, which can use a cloud based service such as Vivaldi.net or Google Calendars, or it can be stored locally. If you're using the Cloud service, the Tasks sync. If you're storing locally, I would assume they would not. I haven't tried that particular configuration, but that makes sense to me.

@vivaldibrowser

There was stuff in there that was so old I don't even remember what I was talking about. I've been recently using the tasks list in Outlook (work account) because I need to have that software anyway. Making it easy, keeping it front and center, and syncing it across devices is good motivation for moving out of Outlook for this functionality.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-10-01 22:50

@chrisod I was at one point thinking of automating the creation of blog posts from the posts I make here on Fosstodon. It would be easy enough to do. Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-30 16:45

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-30 16:18

@fedops Interesting idea, but won't work out of the gate. It leaves in SO MUCH text that's not part of the article itself. One of the articles I tested left every option in a toggle menu in the text that was output. It could (in theory) be used to automate the text extraction copy/paste part, but I'd still have to go through and manually strip out so much irrelevant material from the file(s) before I could do the TTS conversion. That seems to be the biggest hurdle to this being easy.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-30 15:48

@sayanarijit That's fine if I want to stay at my desk, but I didn't see any of those extensions (in my admittedly brief "research" on the subject) that allowed the audio to be saved to MP3. I listen to these files when I'm away from my desk most of the time.

The other bit that's a little bit icky is even though they're open source, they're using TTS engines like Wavenet and Polly. The fact that Mimic3 is local and private is a definite benefit in my opinion.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-29 17:07

@Kauer Heh, it is S3, but the customer literally sent their keys (even the secret one) to a distribution list of more than 20 people. It's stored in plain text in several different documents they've exchanged with us, and I have no idea how many people have access to it on their side of things. On our side, lots. They don't use any at rest encryption other than that.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-28 21:56

@adamsdesk@mastodon.technology These guys are just trying to find a good excuse, and they don't really know a lot about what they're talking about. They think that disk level encryption replaces PGP. They also made sure to mention later on in a part I didn't mention that they wanted us to use SSL for the file transfers. Lots of hand waving regarding security, but they sent user/password in the same email plain text. Drive encryption and SSL isn't going fix that.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-28 21:52

@kdenlive@mastodon.technology Gratz!! That's great to hear!

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-28 19:58

Me: I'll need your PGP key.

Them: We'll be leveraging server-side-encryption for the incoming data. The server encrypts objects before saving them to disks and decrypts them when objects are downloaded.

Me: Sooooo, you don't have one. OK. 🙄

@mogwai The digital eyepiece is pretty nice. I've got a phone mount that lines things up with the regular lens, but the phone keeps trying to automatically adjust things and things like planets always seem to be overexposed. We didn't get the best digital eyepiece on the market, and we're thinking of upgrading. The only real problems we have with it is figuring out the orientation and having to find objects with weaker lenses and then swapping them out without losing them. That's a pain.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-27 14:50

@vancha It is. Something about the orbits of Jupiter and Earth not being perfectly circular, and that means that last night is the closest Earth and Jupiter have been in almost 60 years. It's not dramatic like some sci-fi thing, but enough to be noticeable. The rumor was you were supposed to be able to make out the color bands with something as simple as a pair of binoculars. We briefly tried that for fun, but couldn't really make anything out. Telescope worked much better.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-26 18:57

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-26 15:52

@kev One of the features that Fitbit (and other fitness trackers I assume) has is the Daily Readiness. This is something I haven't had until this latest iteration, and I've come to really depend on. It takes all sorts of metrics and calculates how hard you should push yourself on any given day, if at all. When it first showed up I pretty much ignored it, but I found pretty quickly that it's alarmingly accurate. If my Readiness score is low. I'll take things easy. If it's high, I'll push.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-26 15:40

@gregandcin Yea, that seems to be a killer feature. My Fitbit can't seem to pull that off with any reliability either. I end up with a bunch of dead notification on my watch all the time. I'm hoping that if anything comes of Google buying Fitbit, it's them FINALLY figuring out how that notification stuff works. Oh, and the UI for Fitbit kinda blows, so it would be good if they could fix that too.

@gadgetbridge @JF

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-26 15:33

@gregandcin Ironically that's one of the things I liked most about my PineTime. I didn't setup any notifications on it at all. Notifications are a bane of my existence because I'm pretty terrible at managing them. It's my understanding that in the near future Android is going to be moving to an opt-in method instead of opt-out. That could potentially help me a whole lot.

@gadgetbridge

@gregandcin I'll have to look into that, but the tracking stuff is really the only reason I use the Fitbit in the first place. Otherwise the #PineTime would be perfect for me. I do notice that GadgetBridge supports the PineTime, so if/when I end up back with it that might be the way I go.

#lizard
Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-24 05:56

@wholesomedonut Yep, they were originally supposed to ship in 2018. They're more than 4 years late. On the company timeline they published around that time, they were expecting to have shipped the Mark3 by now. It's been a long time coming.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-24 05:54

We seem to have involuntarily aquired a pet.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-24 05:33

@ryo Mycroft itself can integrate with pretty much anything you can code a connection with if you're in the mood to drop in some Python. Otherwise it ties into #HomeAssistant and can currently do the basics like lights and doors. It would be nice to get some better integration between the two. The connection to HA could potentially give you access to any number of devices all over the smart home market.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-24 05:30

@oss Yea, not to go into complete shill mode here (I am a fan though, so no promises) the software is currently available on GitHub (https://github.com/MycroftAI/mycroft-core), and I've had a lot of success just basically running it on anything I try. Even got it to work on my #PinePhone. It's also been integrated with the new KDE Plasma Bigscreen for the voice control aspects.

https://nationworldnews.com/bigscreen-plasma-5-26-brings-the-linux-desktop-to-the-television/#:~:text=Most%20current%20and%20future%20apps%20can%20already%20be%20controlled%20through%20the%20open%2Dsource%20language%20assistant%20Mycroft%20AI%2C%20which%2C%20unlike%20Alexa%2C%20is%20fully%20decentralized%20and%20works%20locally%20as%20well.

If you want to test it out, it runs on as little as a Pi3, though you can't really get the #Mimic3 with that.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-24 03:49

@oss It's kinda like an Amazon Echo, but made with mostly publicly available parts with the exception of a custom board and a fully open source software stack. You can literally run the whole thing offline if you want, or use their cloud based backend. The software is written in Python and can be easily added to with Skills to perform whatever task you want.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-24 03:38

Progress has been made! Delivery in November. I was hoping for sooner, but November is better than never.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-16 15:28

@fury@indieweb.social I've worked shifts before. I've buffed floors in a grocery store and hucked bales and moved irrigation pipe. The problem isn't with having routines. I have many. The problem is with never evaluating those routines.

There are always going to be parts of jobs you don't like. The trick is, big picture, is this somewhere you want to be? Even if it's not, I don't suggest just quitting right now, but thinking about how you put yourself somewhere you do want to be, even if it's hard.

@feli@mk.paritybit.ca

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-16 02:41

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-15 17:46

@feli@mk.paritybit.ca I would agree that's what a routine is, and if a routine is beneficial to you that's great! The problem is when you're encouraged not to evaluate whether that routine is benefiting you or is toxic. If your routine is toxic to you as a person, you SHOULD evaluate that routine and make changes to it.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-15 17:03

Saw this in a post this morning. I realize that this is supposed to be "inspirational" and show strong work ethic and determination, but Wow does that sound depressing to me. This dude is just roboting through his life like he's "supposed to".

I think there are a fair number of us that are stuck working jobs we'd rather not, but there's no harm in evaluating where you are and realizing you don't want to be there. If you're not happy, you shouldn't stay. Find somewhere you enjoy being.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-15 15:46

@ocdtrekkie Yea, I doubt it's novel, but I haven't had a lot of luck finding them outside of kits like Google's AIY, and definitely not at the $25-$50 price range. I picked up a Respeaker microphone array a while back, and that's running almost $30 by itself, and that has no speakers.

@Tekchip

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-15 14:58

@Tekchip I cracked open the box to get a peek at the kit again since it's been so long. The biggest hurdle is this. There's really not that much in the box. A button (easy), a couple of standard cables (easy again), a microphone array (harder but still doable), and a custom Pi hat to interface with both the microphone and speakers (that's the hard part). That hat is going to be hard to come by. It's made by Google specifically for the AIY kits. I'm not sure on a replacement.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-14 21:35

https://fosstodon.org/emoji/sheet_13.png

There's a video that weirdly shows the individual emoji that are in that file loading slowly, but to load one of those emoji the whole file would have to have been downloaded. It's not going to regrab the whole file each time, that would be a huge waste, so I have to assume it's in the processing of that image. Just guessing at this point.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-14 20:55

https://fosstodon.org/@ProfessorCode/108997805067059297

The custom ones seem to load up fairly quickly, but the default bunch we still loading at the end of the 35 second video. I don't know how long it took to eventually get them all done.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-13 18:06

@ocdtrekkie Still pretty cool. I've been thinking of doing some of that since I've started using Home Assistant, but haven't buckled down and done any work. Most of the time I use my "smart home" stuff for automation, so voice control has always been more of an ad-hoc thing. I like it, but it's more of a nice to have rather than a requirement. Mycroft interfaces with Home Assistant relatively well (could still use some work), so it does most of what I need. Everything else could be scripts+cron.

Mike Stone @mike 2022-09-13 16:53

@ocdtrekkie Yea, since the Mark II is so delayed (4 years!!!!) I've wanted to roll my own several times during that time. The problem I've run into is a graceful way to have both speakers and a microphone that doesn't involve a ton of external hardware. There's Pi hats that can do one of those well, but I haven't found a GOOD way to have a speaker and a mic on a Pi without using a USB device. That gets messy fast.
